title: Network Engineer
description:
**N E T W O R K E N G I N E E R**  

**\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_**  

Full-time | Permanent

 **A B O U T X E N I T**  

Xenit is a growth company which specializes in Cloud and modern work. Our committed employees inspire, challenge and encourage each other, while providing extensive value for our customers.  

Xenit is **Microsoft's Partner of the Year, Sweden** for 2024, illustrating our commitment to technical development, being on the cutting edge of tech, and our close partnership with Microsoft.  

  

**W H A T W E N E E D**  

We are looking for a talented **Network Engineer** to join Xenit's Cloud Infrastructure team. Currently, within our Cloud Enablement department, there is only one dedicated Network resource, and we'd really like to increase that to two. This would be someone to take over some of our existing projects, to work with our Network as a Service, and to bolster our Network offering for prospective new customers.  

  

**Examples of potential tasks:**  

* Configuring new customer sites
* Planning and executing firewall & network implementation projects, and completing documentation
* Supporting other teams/team members with networking questions
* Helping with network pre-sale and design when selling Network as a Service.

  

**C O U L D Y O U B E A M A T C H ?**  

**We believe our next Network Engineer has:**  

* 5 years experience with Networks: Firewalls (preferably Palo Alto), Switching, Routing, Troubleshooting.
* The ability to perform basic server set ups


- An understanding of overall infrastructure - Servers, Virtualization, Security, Cloud services (Azure as a preference).  

* Experience with both Network pre-sale and design.
  

  

**It is a bonus if you have:**  

* Knowledge of IT-Security
* Experience with authentication and federation (Active Directory/NPS, SAML, OIDC/OAUTH)
* Relevant Microsoft, Cisco or Palo Alto certifications
* Knowledge of ITIL
  

  

**We also believe that you are a person who:**  

* Acts on their own initiative, makes things happen and takes **responsibility** for their work
* Finds joy in learning about new technologies, and wants to keep up to date with trends in their field
* Has a methodical and structured way of working


- Understands complex issues and is able to solve them - making sensible and rational judgements.  

* Collaborates effectively with others and builds good relationships with both customers and colleagues
* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish and English
* Above all else, displays kindness and compassion in everything they do

  

  

**W H Y C H O O S E X E N I T ?**  

**Benefits**  

Xenit boasts a large benefits package, read full list here.  

  

**Super interesting colleagues**  

With us you will find spinning instructors, parkour practitioners, gamers, art historians, rugby players, puzzle maniacs, film geeks and much more.  

With us, you are free to be who you are. Our workforce is so diverse, that one of the only things each person has in common is an incredible drive and passion for what they do.  

  

**Activities**  

Each quarter, we host **Xenit Inspire** where employees are able to share specialist knowledge, information about cool projects, and take part in tasks centered around innovation - workshops and hackathons. We also offer annual conferences, team building, after works, and "Bring a Buddy" lunches at the office.  

  

Last year, Xenit was awarded **"Career Company of 2024"**. This prestigious recognition underscores our commitment to fostering a workplace culture that values inclusivity, well-being, and growth.  

*"Xenit is an outstanding employer where corporate culture and well-being are at the center. Here, the employees are part of a warm and inclusive community where their well-being and well-being are prioritized. By offering an environment where collaboration, creativity and innovation are encouraged, employees can thrive and develop while contributing to the company's success."*  

**Read more about Karriar Företagen** **here****.**

title: Security Principal
description:
**Grow with us**
----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

We are looking for the Engineering Environment Security Principal for PDU Packet Core.  

You will join the organization responsible for the Engineering Environment that manages all tools, clouds, networks, test channels and other environments used in the Packet Core Product development.  

You will be responsible for security in this area, driving improvement work and assessments for the different parts of the environment and collaborate with other roles to make the best possible support to product development teams and other users.  

You will coordinate a network of security masters in all the DevOps and Tools teams we have across the organization located in several Packet Core development sites to help you!

 **What you will do:**

* Drive Data and IT Security for Packet Core development and test environments
* Provide support in IT security related matters to the PC Engineering Environment program
* Cooperate with various engineering teams for the fulfilment of Corporate security requirements and R&D IT guidelines
* Coordinate and support the network of Security Masters across Packet Core Engineering Environment
* Packet Core SPOC for R&D IT security matters within BCSS
* Maintain the Engineering Environment IT Security Architecture in collaboration with the EE system architect
* Be part of IT security-related task forces within Packet Core Engineering Environment
* Assist devops teams in the automation and tools areas with security expertise
* Participate in the R&D Environment LT, bringing in the security perspective

 **The skills you bring:**

* Master’s degree in Information Technology or equivalent
* High level of competence in IT Security for Software Development is a must
* Network and IT Security in areas such as intrusion, integrity, reliability, authentication/authorization etc.
* Understanding traceability and its importance for security
* Knowledge in Linux OS security
* Security aspects of virtualization in a cloud environment (Kubernetes)
* Good communication skills, innovating, adapting and responding to change
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum way of working
* Ability to deliver results and meet customer expectations
* Coping with pressures & setbacks
* Empowered to take decisions in a multi-stakeholder arena
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Göteborg

**Req ID:** 759827

title: Cyber Security Engineer
description:
Overview: **Expleo** is seeking a highly skilled and experienced **Senior DevSecOps Consultant** to join our team in **Sweden** (located in Gothenburg OR Stockholm).  

Our **ideal** candidate has strong problem-solving skills, an analytical mindset and the ability to lead the integration of security into the development and operations processes.  

If you are a full-stack engineer looking to expand your skill set, we'd love to hear from you. Join our team today and take the next step in your career!
Responsibilities:
* DevSecOps Strategy Implementation: Support and implement a comprehensive DevSecOps strategy that aligns with organizational objectives and security standards.
* CI/CD Pipeline Security Integration: Integrate security tools and practices within CI/CD pipelines to automate security checks and ensure continuous security compliance.
* Security Automation and Orchestration: Design and implement security automation scripts and workflows to enhance the efficiency of the DevSecOps process.
* Infrastructure as Code (IaC) Security: Ensure security best practices are embedded in IaC scripts and configurations.
* Container and Microservices Security: Implement security measures for containerized applications and microservices architectures.
* Collaboration and Training: Work collaboratively with development and operations teams to build a strong DevSecOps culture; provide training and mentorship in security best practices.


Qualifications:
* Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in DevSecOps, with a proven track record of implementing security in DevOps environments.
* Expertise in automation and orchestration tools (e.g., Jenkins, Ansible, Chef, Puppet).
* Proficient in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) and understanding of cloud-native security principles.
* Good knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes) and their security configurations.
* Experience with infrastructure as code (Terraform, CloudFormation) and ensuring the security of IaC.
* Proficient in implementing and configuring security tools such as SAST, DAST, IAST, RASP, and vulnerability scanners.
* Familiarity with secure coding practices and application security standards.
* Strong understanding of network and application security, threat modeling, risk assessment techniques, and cybersecurity frameworks (e.g., OWASP, NIST).
* Knowledge of compliance requirements (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).


Benefits:
**Who are we?**
Expleo is a rapidly growing consulting company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions in the fields of AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science. With a strong commitment to integrity, diversity, sustainability, and societal security, Expleo is at the forefront of creating a better future. Join our dynamic team and be part of our journey to shape the future of technology and business. **What do we offer?*** Collaborative working environment – we stand shoulder to shoulder with our clients and our peers through good times and challenges
* We empower all passionate technology loving professionals by allowing them to expand their skills and take part in inspiring projects
* Expleo Academy - enables you to acquire and develop the right skills by delivering a suite of accredited training courses
* Always working as one team, our people are not afraid to think big and challenge the status quo
* Collective agreement with the union
* Access to a collection of benefits and discounted prices on services and shops.
* Health benefits
* Expleo team activities

  

"We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age”.

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 You will act as both Tech Lead and Manager, in a perfect mix of leading people (Team of Developers) and developing code. Our aim is to consolidate the team of developers that you will lead in Stockholm. You will collaborate with your Product Partner, regarding planning and building the right products at the right time. You will be responsible for defining clear goals for your team and lead them in delivering on those goals.
   

  

 Apart from this, you are also responsible for setting salaries, helping individuals on your team grow and developing, as well as contributing technically to the team.
   

  

 As Tech Lead Manager you have a holistic perspective and the ability to inspire and lead others. You love working with tech and have experience working as a developer, working with code reviews, testing and quality assurance. You have at least one area where your team can rely on you making strong technical contributions.
   

  

* Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders
* Define quarterly goals and do weekly follow-ups
* Support and make sure the team members are the best they can be
* Develop and coach your team members individually
* Facilitate daily stand-ups and advise on agile WoW
* Contribute technically (wherever your strong area is) to the team


**Requirements**
* MSc/BS in computer science or similar degree
* Experience working as a Manager for a Tech Team
* Working in different contexts and organisations
* Interest in leadership and developing teams
* Proficient in English, both verbal and written
* Business minded and able to see the big picture
* A natural leader who is caring and inspiring
* Able to communicate clearly, both with your team and stakeholders
* Well organized and goal oriented


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: IT-konsult
description:
**IT-Konsult hos CAPSAB - Card and Payment Solutions AB** 




  





 Vi expanderar och söker nya talanger!
 



  





 Är du en driven och erfaren IT-konsult som vill vara med på en spännande resa? CAPSAB - Card and Payment Solutions AB är i en expansiv fas och söker nu nya medarbetare som vill bidra till vår fortsatta utveckling och hjälpa våra kunder att skapa framtidens IT-lösningar.
 



  





**Om CAPSAB:** 




 CAPSAB - Card and Payment Solutions AB är en ledande aktör inom betalningslösningar och kortteknik men erbjuder även konsulttjänster inom en mängd andra områden kring IT. Vi arbetar nära våra kunder inom olika branscher och hjälper dem att utveckla och implementera effektiva och innovativa tekniska lösningar. Eftersom vi är i en tillväxtfas söker vi nu fler IT-konsulter som vill arbeta med olika typer av IT-uppdrag och vara en viktig del i kundernas digitalisering och tekniska utveckling.
 



  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Arbeta hos våra kunder med att implementera och optimera olika IT-lösningar och systemintegrationer.
* Bidra till utvecklingen av effektiva och användarvänliga system och applikationer.
* Hjälpa kunderna att skapa skräddarsydda lösningar som möter deras unika behov.
* Samarbeta med kundernas interna team för att säkerställa en smidig och framgångsrik implementation av lösningar.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om den senaste utvecklingen inom IT och bidra med idéer för att förbättra kundernas system och processer.



  





**Vi söker dig som:** 



* Har erfarenhet av IT-konsultverksamhet och vill arbeta nära kundens verksamhet inom olika IT-områden.
* Är en problemlösare som brinner för att hitta lösningar och skapa värde för kunderna.
* Har god förmåga att kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett enkelt och tydligt sätt.
* Talar och skriver på svenska och engelska obehindrat.



  





**Vi erbjuder:** 



* En unik möjlighet att vara en del av ett expansivt och innovativt företag.
* Ett varierande och dynamiskt arbete där du får möjlighet att arbeta med olika kunder och projekt inom hela IT-området.
* En arbetsmiljö som främjar personlig och professionell utveckling.
* Ett engagerat team som värdesätter samarbete och kunskapsdelning.
* Dedikerade konsultchefer som finns med genom hela uppdraget och som skapar de bästa förutsättningarna för att du ska lyckas.



  





**Intresserad?** 




 Skicka din spontanansökan med CV och ett personligt brev till konsultchefen@capsab.com eller här på LinkedIn.
 



 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och välkomna dig till vårt team!
 



  





 Ansök gärna så snart som möjligt.

title: IT-konsult
description:
Jobbar du inom IT-branschen och söker nya utmaningar?
   

  

 Vi på Sogeti erbjuder intressanta och utvecklande kunduppdrag inom många olika branscher. Som systemutvecklare hos oss har du möjlighet att arbeta med allt från systemintegration, cloud, business intelligence och test till att utveckla webbar, appar, intranät, mobila lösningar, mm.
   

  

 Vår arbetsplats präglas av positiv attityd där vi hjälper varandra och har kul på jobbet. Lika viktigt är vår satsning på erfarenhetsutbyte och kompetensutveckling. Hos oss har du stora möjligheter att växa både som person och konsult.
   

  

 Gillar du teknik, är flexibel och intresserad av människor så kommer du att trivas hos oss på Sogeti.
   

  

 ,
   

  

 Vi söker dig som uppskattar hantverket, som ständigt vill utvecklas, som håller dig i teknikens framkant och som söker en ny utmaning! Du brinner för modern webbutveckling med t.ex. React, Node.js, Angular eller kanske backend-programmering med Web-API, Databaser, Azure (eller andra cloudlösningar), C#, Entity Framework. Du kanske rent av är av typen fullstack som behärskar båda världarna och som gärna tar ett ansvar som lösningsarkitekt?
   

  

 Kanske har du erfarenhet av Sharepoint (eller annat CMS för intranät) eller att jobba med integration med t.ex. Biztalk eller SSIS? Det finns uppdrag för dig med!
   

  

 Viktigast av allt är att du känner starkt för att arbeta som konsult och att du är positiv, engagerad och fokuserad.
   

  

 Ansök via länken. Det tar bara någon minut och du kan bifoga din LinkedIn-profil.
   

  

 Rekrytering sker löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan.

title: IT-konsult inom servicedesk
description:
Älskar du att hjälpa till och har samtidigt en bred kompetens inom IT? I den här rollen som IT-konsult inom servicedesk kommer du få arbeta med användarsupport och lösning av IT-incidenter genom felsökning och diagnostisering.
   

  

 Uppdragslängd: start snarast – ca 6 månader med ev. möjlighet till förlängning.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Du kommer att arbeta med support för att hjälpa svenska användare och att lösa deras tekniska problem genom felsökning. Arbetet sker primärt via telefon och mailkontakt samt en viss del via på-platssupport. Du kommer även att hantera beställningar inom IT såsom datorer, skärmar m.m.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 Vi söker dig som trivs med att arbeta i en serviceroll, är kundfokuserad och serviceinriktad. Det är viktigt att du ser dig själv som en lagspelare som tillsammans med andra jobbar mot långsiktiga men även kortsiktiga mål. Du är van att jobba i ärendehanteringssystem, kunskapsdatabaser och remote-verktyg.
   

  

 Du pratar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat och din goda grund i engelska blir särskilt viktig då du kommer tillhöra ett virtuellt globalt IT-team med internationella kollegor och kunder.
   

  

 Som person är du nyfiken och engagerad och följer med i IT-utvecklingen. Andra viktiga egenskaper är att du vill utvecklas och har en lösningsorienterad inställning i allt du gör. Det här uppdraget passar dig med viljan att ge service och att utvecklas.
   

  

*Meriterande*
* MS Office365
* Active Directory
* Applikationer t.ex. SAP och produktionsnära applikationer
* Kunskap inom telefoni och skrivare
* Språkkunskaper utöver svenska/engelska
* Förståelse för nätverk och kommunikation


**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Head of Managed Services
Open Application
description:
We are always looking for talented people to join our team. Unlock your future and join us in the Software Asset Management transformation!
   

  

 We believe that investing in our employees is crucial to reach our goals. That's why we encourage you to apply for this Open Application, since we provide a wide range of opportunities for all kinds of roles, both entry-level and for experienced professionals.
   

  

 Xensam is not just hiring employees; we're building a community of individuals who resonate with our core values – rebellious, humane, and harmony. Embrace your rebellious spirit, find support in a humane environment, and experience the harmonious blend of work and life. We believe in fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where all individuals are valued, respected, and empowered to be themselves.
   

  

 If you are interested to join the party, please send in your spontanous application here! Attach your resume and let us know what kind of role you would be interested in and why you would like to work at Xensam. Express your interest in the area that aligns with your experiences and skills.
   

  

**Qualifications To Work At Xensam**
* Dynamic individual with a rebellious spirit and innovative mind
* Highly organized and proactive in initiating creative solutions
* Enthusiastic about collaborating with a diverse, driven team
* Strong problem-solving mindset


**What You Get At Xensam**
* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* More benefits depending on location.


**At Xensam, Our Core Values Define Our Culture**
**Rebellious** 
 : We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
   

  

**Humane** 
 : We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
   

  

**Harmonious** 
 : We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
   

  

 Join our Open Application process and become a valued member of our candidate pool! We regularly review all applications, and if a position matches your skills and interests, we’ll be excited to reach out to you.
   

  

 Don’t forget to "connect" and follow us on LinkedIn to stay in the loop about new opportunities and the latest happenings at Xensam!
   

  

 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered Software Asset Management technology. Designed to provide SAM Managers and IT Leaders with valuable data, our platform offers a wealth of features to simplify SAM workloads with built-in automation and advanced functionality. We prioritize ease of use and industry-leading security for both On-premise and Cloud software, putting organizations in total control of their hybrid IT environments.

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
**Are you a skilled backend software developer ready to grow into a leadership role while staying hands-on in technology?** 
 Join us as a Tech Lead Manager, where you'll lead an empowered development team delivering scalable components for data optimization, billing, account management, and product configuration tooling.
   

  

 This role offers a perfect blend of leadership and technical contributions, giving you the opportunity to guide a team of developers while actively shaping the technical direction.
   

  

**Responsabilities**
* Define clear goals, coach your team members, and foster a collaborative, growth-oriented environment.
* Work closely with your product partner to plan and build the right solutions at the right time.
* Stay hands-on by contributing to backend development, driving DevOps practices, and supporting code reviews, testing, and quality assurance.
* Manage salaries, performance, and career development for your team members.
* Ensure high-quality, timely delivery of technical solutions that meet business needs.
* Balance people leadership with strong technical contributions, making yourself a go-to resource for the team.


**Requirements**
* Strong experience in backend development such as .NET or Java technologies.
* Hands-on knowledge of DevOps practices, including CI/CD and infrastructure as code, and Kubernetes.
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
* Experience with code reviews, testing, and ensuring software quality.
* Proven leadership experience or a strong desire to grow into a management role.
* Excellent communication skills in English, with the ability to align stakeholders.
* A collaborative, goal-oriented mindset with the ability to inspire and support your team.


 Embrace the challenge and join us!
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Swedbank Analyst Trainee program
description:
Do you have a burning interest in the finance industry and want to give your career a flying start?
 




 Are you a recent M.Sc. graduate or at the beginning of your career in Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Macroeconomics, Statistics, Computer Science, or similar fields? Do you aspire to excel in the financial industry and want to give your career a flying start? As one of Sweden's largest commercial banks, with 7.4 million private customers and 553 000 corporate clients across Sweden, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania, Swedbank stands as the leading bank for numerous households and businesses. Not only that, Swedbank Robur has also been recognised as an award-winning fund management company. We are now looking for new talents to join us in our journey to shape the future of banking!
 



 Starting your career at Swedbank Analyst Program offers an excellent opportunity to gain insights in core banking functions such as Risk Management, Investor Relations, Business Steering, and the Business side. Joining our program means that you will rotate between various units within the bank, gaining invaluable experience from different perspectives that will enhance your professional growth, spanning 10 months. As part of the program, you will be assigned and employed in one of the units presented below led by your recruiting manager, which serves as your base unit throughout your time in the program. Our aim is that after completing the 10-month rotation across various departments, you will return to the base unit with the ambition to continue your employment within their team.
 



 The trainee program is designed for junior candidates with a strong academic background and limited work experience. We are offering 11 exclusive positions for the 2025/2026 set-up and the program is based in Stockholm at Swedbank HQ, starting September 2025.
 



**The following units are part of the 2025/2026 program:** 




****Within Swedish Banking, you will work with:****
**Data Science & Analytics:** 
 The Decision Analytics team enables Swedish Banking to make simple, consistent credit decisions for private customers, and manages the consequences of those decisions. We build the tools to actively control loan origination, closely monitor performance across the credit lifecycle and ensure sufficient provision are made for losses.
   

**Pricing & Proactivity:** 
 Develop models to identify and predict customer behaviour for proactivity, as well as models and financial steering within pricing of interest-bearing products.
   

**Insights and Optimization:** 
 Our unit’s focus is on using empirical data, statistical models, and advanced analytics to uncover trends, patterns and actionable intelligence. It involves analysing customer behaviour, financial market trends, efficiency of both internal systems and work force. Our goal is to use sophisticated data analysis to ensure that the portfolio remains balanced, healthy, and aligned with the bank’s strategic objectives, reducing risk and optimizing performance.
   

  

**Within Group Product and Advice, you will work with:**
**Performance & Sustainability Analytics:** 
 Analyse and transform large datasets into actionable insights to enhance savings products and services.
 



**Within CFO Office, you will work with:** 
  

**Group Business Steering:** 
 Develops the frameworks, models and systems for steering the business. The main focus is to secure accurate profitability measures, relevant activity and effect performance indicators and omnichannel price management capabilities for the bank.
   

**Investor Relations:** 
 Analyse financial results of Swedbank and our peers in order to create our financial messaging. Experience the interim report writing process.
   

**Valuation Control:** 
 Owners of the bank’s internal market data hub, responsible for the internal valuation control framework as well as profit and loss reporting. As a valuation control analyst, you will work in close relation to our development organisation, C&I, Treasury, Accounting, and Group Risk, providing timely and high-quality information while enforcing the bank’s valuation policy. 
   

**Group Treasury:** 
 Work with analysing and processing data to support in financial- and risk analysis, funding and liquidity, and capital planning to optimise risk management and funding execution. You will work with data used by several teams within the unit, and you will get the possibility to have a broad understanding of the Treasury department and how it interlinks with the rest of the bank.
 



**Finally, within Group Risk, you will work with:**
**Group ALM & Aggregation:** 
 Analyse how risks impact Swedbank’s balance sheet through advanced tools like stress testing. Gain comprehensive insights into banking, understand the effects of macroeconomic developments on a bank's income and risks, and apply this knowledge in impactful risk analyses.
   




 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
 * Be part of a skilled organization offering unique opportunities for growth and learning.
* Thrive in a fast-paced environment.
* Support senior colleagues and management, you will have a great opportunity to develop your skills from day one.
* Pursue a career as an analyst within Swedbank.
* Take part of activities to learn about Swedbank’s business strategies, broaden your insights as well as be given the opportunity to network for your professional growth.


 What is needed in this role:
 * M.Sc. in Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Macroeconomics, Statistics or Computer science or similar
* Maximum 1 year of relevant professional experience (after finished studies)
* Strong passion for the financial sector
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to approach problems methodically
* Experience or coursework in analytical tools (e.g. R, SQL, Python, SAS, Matlab or similar)
* Fluency in English, both speaking and writing
* Skilled at communicating insights using Microsoft 365 tools



**Skills that are a plus for this role:** 



* Experience or interest in equity or debt capital markets, or corporate finance, or accounting
* Experience working with practical applications of statistical modelling/machine learning


 What we offer when you join us:
 * An open, simple and caring culture
* Opportunity to create the best experience for our customers
* An international, sustainable and inclusive work environment
* Development opportunities and advancement in your career
* Flexible working options
* Access to Group performance program, company pension plan, optional health insurance, and other benefits


 "Join our team and...
 
 work in a dynamic and interesting environment where you will come across a broad range of highly interesting and challenging assignments covering the whole bank. We work in important functions that strive to deliver with high efficiency, quality and value for our stakeholders. You will work with motivated people with high competence and expertise within the different areas. If you have a personal drive and goal focus, we think you will enjoy working with us." 
 **Emma Jansson, Nellie Felländer your future leaders** 



 We look forward to receiving your application by 27.01.2025.
   


**Location: Stockholm HQ**




**Recruiting manager: Emma Jansson, Nelli Felländer**




 Wemay begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome yourapplication as soon as possible.
 



*We have made our choice regardingrecruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers orsellers of other recruitment services.* 




  

****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Consultancy: Information and Digital Security Training, Kvinna till Kvinna in North Macedonia
description:
**The Kvinna till Kvinna Foundation is seeking to engage a Consultant or a team of Consultants to provide Information and Digital Security Training for WCSOs i.e. partner organisations in North Macedonia.**
**Please read more in the terms of reference below.**
**Terms of Reference**
* Background


 The Kvinna till Kvinna Foundation (Kvinna till Kvinna) is a Swedish organisation that supports women in areas affected by war and conflict, to increase women’s power and influence. Today we cooperate with more than 130 women’s organisations in five regions. Kvinna till Kvinna started at the beginning of the 1990’s in the Western Balkans as a direct result of the atrocities of the war.
   

  

 We collaborate with women's organisations that play an active part in peace and transition processes as well as promoting women’s rights and gender equality.
   

  

 The mandate of Kvinna till Kvinna is to:
   

  

* Empower women in war and conflict-affected regions by enhancing


 their self-esteem, their mental and physical well-being and their participation in the creation of a democratic society.
   

  

* Promote studies and research concerning the effects of war and armed conflict on women.
* Provide information about the effects of war and to raise public opinion in favour of peaceful conflict resolution using non-military methods.


 Kvinna till Kvinna shall operate without attaching importance to religious, political, national or ethnic affiliation. These requirements also apply to Kvinna till Kvinna’s partner organisations.
   

  

***Bilateral programme ”Strengthening Women’s Rights and Women’s Participation in North***
***Macedonia”***
 Kvinna till Kvinna, in partnership with six women’s rights organisations working for women’s rights and gender equality, is implementing a bilateral programme (2020-2025) in North Macedonia. The purpose of the programme is to make use of the window of opportunity provided by the conditionality of the EU-accession process, to achieve positive changes with regards to gender equality and women’s rights, contributing also to Sweden’s new strategy for the Western Balkans.
   

  

**The programme has three thematic focuses, that is:**
* Prevention of and protection from gender-based violence. The goal is to contribute to better access to justice for rights holders and rule of law through policy and attitude changes regarding gender-based violence;
* The women, peace and security agenda. The goal is to create conditions for women and girls to participate fully and effectively in the development of an equal and democratic society, and towards the implementation of the women, peace and security agenda; and
* Women’s economic empowerment. The goal is to contribute to changes in policy and practice regarding women’s economic empowerment (WEE).


 One of the strategic methods of the programme is capacity development activities for the partner organisations and other women’s civil society organisations (WCSOs), based on their needs.
   

  

* Objectives and Scope of the Assignment


 WCSOs and women human rights defenders (WHRDs) operate in challenging environments, facing unique threats and coordinated efforts to discredit and silence them. Their increasing reliance on digital technology exposes them to cybersecurity incidents, making it essential to understand these risks and adopt secure practices. While cyber-attacks are on the rise, very few organisations have basic security policies and protocols. Hence, WCSOs and WHRDs need solid understanding of digital information security and practical skills to mitigate threats effectively. Information and Digital security training will equip organisations with hands-on learning to navigate and be safer in the digital environment.
   

  

 The Consultant/s shall:
   

  

* Assess the capacity of the selected Civil Society Organisations and their knowledge in information and digital security.
* Design a tailor-made training module to address the main identified capacity gaps.
* Develop a training plan and agenda
* Conduct a live training in information and digital security in line with the designed training module and training plan.
* The training agenda should cover topics from the following list:
* Information Classification and CIA
* Data Protection and Web Application Security Testin
* Secure Sharing of Information and Documents
* Protection and Management of Personal and Sensitive Data
* Secure e-mail management
* Secure Password Management
* Two-Factor and Multi-Factor Authentication
* Data Encryption
* Antivirus and Security Software
* Online Scams/E-mail scams
* Phishing Attacks and Malware
* Safe Use of the Internet, Wi-Fi, and HTTPS
* Networks and Information Systems
* E-Services, Electronic Documents, and Digital Signatures
* Security Risks and Incidents, including response
* Staying secure while working remotely
* Social Media Security practices
* How to be secure in case of loss of device/theft
* Other area/s, identified by the consultant/s
* Expected outcome of the Assignment


 The Consultant/s is expected to design and provide on-site training on Information and Digital Security for Kvinna till Kvinna partner organisations in North Macedonia. Total thirteen civil society organisations represented with two staff members each will attend the training.
   

  

 At the end of the training program, participants should have gained improved understanding and knowledge on Information and Digital Security, and be equipped with basic skills to protect digital information and manage security risks.
   

  

* Deliverables:


 The following deliverables are required under this assignment:
   

  

* An assessment of the level of understanding and needs of current Kvinna till Kvinna


 partners in North Macedonia in the areas of information and digital security
   

  

* A tailored training module which includes the main findings from the assessment
* Designed and developed training plan and agenda
* A live three-day training for up to 26 persons, representing 13 organisations delivered
* Final report on the training with key conclusions and recommendations for future work


 on information and digital security for this target group
   

  

* An online consultation with Kvinna till Kvinna staff, based on the final report and


 experiences drawn during the training.
   

  

* Methodology


 Easily accessible, online assessment. On-site, interactive training in North Macedonia, tailored to professional staff of WCSOs and WHRDs. All information gathered during the preparation and implementation of the assignment will be documented in the final report to Kvinna till Kvinna.
   

  

 Detailed planning and priorities of the assignment, including methodology and training agenda will be discussed and agreed with Kvinna till Kvinna.
   

  

* Time frame and reporting


 The duration of the assignment is between 27th of February – 30th March 2025. The final report to Kvinna till Kvinna shall be submitted no later than March 30th, 2025.
   

  

 The training programme is scheduled to take place the third week of March 2025. A total of eight(8) full days is expected to be used for this assignment: One (1) day assessment design and analysis; Two (2) days training preparation; Three (3) days for training implementation; and two (2) days for the post-training report and feedback/consultation with Kvinna till Kvinna staff.
   

  

* Contact person at Kvinna till Kvinna


 The Consultant/s will work in close dialogue with Kvinna till Kvinna’s Programme Officer in North Macedonia, Emilija Dimoska Trajkovska, emilija.dimoska@kvinnatillkvinna.se.
   

  

* Required skills and qualifications


 The Consultant/s should have:
   

  

 − Extensive experience in Information and Digital Security, in theory and practice.
   

  

 − Documented skills in implementing interactive trainings on different aspects of
   

  

 information and digital security, preferable including targeting civil society
   

  

 organisations and WHRDs.
   

  

 − Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills and demonstrated ability to
   

  

 engage and communicate effectively.
   

  

 − Knowledge on gendered aspects of information and digital security is considered an
   

  

 asset.
   

  

 − Knowledge of the security context in the Western Balkans and specifically North
   

  

 Macedonia.
   

  

 − Excellent collaboration and organisational skills.
   

  

 − Ability to speak Macedonian in a professional setting is considered an asset.
   

  

 − Proficiency in English.
   

  

 − Excellent analytical and report writing skills.
   

  

* Application procedure and deadlines


 The assignment is expected to last approximately 8 working days. The Consultant/s needs to present a technical and financial proposal based on the Terms of Reference.
   

  

 The proposal must outline the facilitator’s proposed methodologies, references related to the execution of similar contracts, experience in similar areas, or evidence of knowledge and a proposed timeline. Submission of a proposal on the assignment must be delivered on or before 27 January, 2025 via Kvinna till Kvinna’s career platform.
   

  

 Kvinna till Kvinna intends to sign a contract no later than February 27th, 2025.

title: Solutions Architect

description:

title: Data Management Expert
description:
Are you passionate about data and eager to make a significant impact in a dynamic organization? At NCC, we can offer you just that, and we are now seeking a talented and driven Data Management Expert to join our Data Management Team! As a Data Management Expert, you’ll get the opportunity to help NCC realize one of its strategic initiatives becoming “A Data Informed Company“. You get the opportunity to grow and develop in an environment influenced by sustainability, digitalization, and innovation!
 



  





**We are building for the future** 




 The construction industry is currently facing a development leap where the change agent is spelled digitalization. NCC is leading the way in developing our business and future proofing our IT and Data Capabilities. We are currently recruiting professionals who thrive on becoming important players in our digital transformation journey, taking construction to new heights through IT and Data.
 



 NCC Film: Make it happen
 



  





**The role and key responsibilities**




 As a Data Management Expert, you will play a key role in establishing proper Data Management for our organization’s data. Your primary focus will be on the disciplines of Master & Reference Data Management together with Data Quality Management, ensuring our data is accurate, reliable, and a true asset for the business. You will help us ensure our data can drive business decisions and operational efficiency. You will ensure implementation of principles for how to manage Master and Reference Data and help foster trust in our data assets through Data Quality.
 



  





 This role operates as a key member of the Data Management Team, actively contributing to the organization's overall Data Management ambitions. In addition to driving excellence in Master & Reference Data, and Data Quality Management, the Data Management Expert will collaborate closely with team members to support broader initiatives within Data Management such as Data Governance, ensuring management of data as a strategic asset.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Lead and implement best practices for Master & Reference Data Management across the organization’s data landscape, driving alignment with business objectives.
* Drive initiatives to embed effective Master & Reference Data Management practices into business processes, ensuring data is fit for purpose.
* Define, implement, and enforce standards, principles, and procedures for robust Data Quality Management, with a focus on continuous improvement.
* Develop and oversee processes for Data Quality Incident Management and Data Quality Analysis, ensuring swift resolution and learning.
* Guide Data Area Owners and Data Stewards in defining, measuring, and reporting on KPIs for Data Quality, ensuring alignment with business goals.
* Collaborate with Data Area Owners, Data Stewards, and legal teams to ensure compliance with data-related laws and regulations, including data privacy and retention.
* Partner with cross-functional teams, acting as a bridge between stakeholders, business users, IT teams, data owners, and data consumers to align needs and.
* Promote a culture of communication and teamwork to enhance the understanding and application of Master & Reference Data Management and Data Quality Management principles.
* Evaluate, design, configure, and implement tools and systems for effective Data Quality and Master & Reference Data Management, keeping abreast of new technologies and solutions.
* Shape and contribute to the organization’s “Long, Mid Data Plan” to ensure scalability, innovation, and alignment with long-term objectives.



  





**About Finance & IT** 




 You will join the Group function “Finance & IT”, which leads NCC´s strategic development and major change programs in the business. Finance & IT is NCC’s development and delivery function for IT as well as operations development and research & innovation. We are a Nordic organization working together closely under one common management. Cooperation in- and between units is key for us to deliver value to NCCs business areas, and therefore we have adapted an Agile team-based setup with a focus on collaboration, people and efficient delivery and development.
 



  





**Your experience and background** 



* Proven experience in Data Management, with a focus on Master & Reference Data Management and Data Quality Management.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a strategic mindset, with the ability to understand and enhance complex data processes. We value individuals who thrive in challenges and approach them with creativity.
* Demonstrated excellence in communication and collaboration to work effectively across teams, with proven stakeholder management skills. Leadership abilities, even without formal authority, are a key asset.
* Fluency in English and one Nordic language. Exceptional communication skills are essential.
* Knowledge of DAMA International and the DMBOK2 Framework is a plus, reflecting alignment with industry best practices.
* Familiarity with Microsoft products such as Office 365, Power BI, and Azure is a bonus. More importantly, a curiosity about new ideas and openness to change is what sets you apart.



  





**Additional information** 




 You will be reporting to the IT Competence Manager whilst working cross-functions in an Agile team driven by the Practice Lead of the area.
 



  





 We see great advantage in the employee being based at our head office in Solna, but it is also possible to be stationed at any NCC office in the major cities of Sweden, Denmark, Norway and Finland. The position requires some travelling, although we do apply a flexible way of working and strive to collaborate digitally as much as possible.
 



  





 In accordance with NCCs safety culture we conduct background checks on final candidates.
 



  





**How to apply** 




 In this recruitment, NCC is collaborating with Experis IT, with extensive experience in the recruitment of IT specialists and managers. You apply to the position at www.experis.se. no later than February 17th.
 



 If you have any questions, or want more information, please contact Recruitment Consultants Carina Eyoma, mail: carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, mobile: +46 73-086 22 75. Please note that candidate selection will be ongoing throughout the application period, and that you therefore should apply as soon as possible.
 



  





 Welcome with your application!
 



  





**NCC Offers** 




 NCC strives to be an appealing employer, with a work environment where employees grow and experience well-being. Therefore, we offer a wide range of employee benefits NCC has collective agreements for all employees, providing a solid foundation of security and clear guidelines so that you know what applies to your employment. We also offer excellent opportunities for continued development and a broad range of further education options, allowing for a long career within the company.
 



  





**Build with us - together with the best colleagues in the industry!** 




 At NCC, we are driven to continue developing, whether it's our construction projects or our personal expertise. Every day, we drive the industry's most exciting and complex construction projects forward in close cooperation between our employees, partners and customers.
 



  





 With us, you are a significant employee who contributes to the landmarks that define our cities and communities. Here, our employees take an active role in a corporate culture based on stable values and behaviors for a safe and secure workplace. Our collective expertise and diverse backgrounds make a difference.
 



  





 NCC - one of the leading companies in the Nordics.

title: Information Security Consultant
description:
**B3 Secure arbetar med att stödja sina kunder med kvalitativa införanden och förbättringar av verksamhetskritiska säkerhetssystem och kontroller.**
 B3 växter starkt inom området säkerhet och det vill vi fortsätta att göra framöver. Vår gedigna erfarenhet inom området och våra seniora konsulter gör oss till en attraktiv partner för stora, etablerade företag och myndigheter likväl som nya, snabbfotade uppstickare. Just nu söker vi fler etablerade informationssäkerhetskonsulter som vill vara med och utveckla säkerhetserbjudande till nya höjder. Vi söker dig som vill arbeta i ett företag med sympatiska värderingar, erfarna kollegor och en attraktiv ersättningsmodell. Om du, liksom vi, värnar om en arbetsmiljö där samarbete, prestigelös kunskapsdelning och energi frodas så är detta en unik chans för dig att vara med och bidra till vår starka kultur samtidigt som du ges möjlighet att växa i din yrkesroll.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Som konsult hos oss ges du möjligheter till intressanta uppdrag hos spännande kunder. Att du har förmågan att skapa relationer och på ett prestigelöst sätt samarbeta i team tror vi är avgörande för att du ska lyckas i ditt uppdrag. Hos oss arbetar du i strategiska och rådgivande roller till verksamhetsledning och IT-ansvariga. Du stödjer våra kunder att införa rätt nivå av informations- och IT-säkerhet på ett smidigt och kostnadseffektivt sätt. Detta kan exempelvis göras genom att etablera ett systematiskt och riskbaserat informationssäkerhetsarbete, utforma och inför ett ISMS, genomföra GAP- och riskanalyser och göra informationsklassningar. Uppdragen kan även kretsa kring att upprätta policyer och riktlinjer för införande av skyddsåtgärder.
   

  

**Vi ser att du har följande kvalifikationer:**
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från relevanta områden.
* Du arbetar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
* Det är meriterande om du har arbetat som konsult.


**Vi erbjuder:**
* Attraktiv lönemodell.
* Goda förutsättningar för flexibla arbetstider.
* Möjligheter att gå relevanta utbildningar och ta attraktiva certifikat.
* En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning. Läs mer här


 B3 Secure är en del av B3 Consulting Group, ett av Sveriges snabbast växande företag inom IT och management. Således kan vi erbjuda det bästa av två världar. Styrkan hos ett stort börsnoterat bolag i kombination med den härliga samhörigheten som ett mindre bolag erbjuder.
   

  

 Vi är även stolta över att vi vann priset som ”Årets Karriärföretag 2022" och kom på tredje plats som Sveriges bästa bolag enligt ”Great Place to Work 2021”. Vi tror att det beror på vår energi, vårt sätt att välkomna olikheter och våra erfarenheter som vi gärna delar med oss av. En central del av energiskapandet är vår unika wellness-satsning Team B3. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra, presterar bra och vill vara engagerade kollegor och goda medmänniskor. Det är även viktigt för oss att ge dig möjligheter till att löpande utbilda och certifiera dig inom relevanta områden för att du ska känna att du utvecklas och ökar ditt marknadsvärde.
   

  

 De som jobbar kvar hos oss efter många år pratar om friheten att påverka sina uppdrag, arbetstider och utveckling. De talar även om stoltheten över att vara en del av ett bolag som inte bara levererar förstklassigt resultat till sina kunder utan även tar ansvar för samhället i stort bl.a. genom att vara partner till fina initiativ som Women in Tech, Changers Hub, Pink Programming m.fl.
   

  

**Kontakt:**
 Om du har några frågor så tvekan inte på att kontakta rekryteringsansvariga Melinda Andersson på mejl, melinda.andersson@b3.se

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**Job Overview:** 




 Inetum is seeking an ambitious, accountable and technically-minded Business Development Manager to be part of our growth efforts in the Nordics. This pivotal role will leverage our partnerships with leading technology providers, focusing predominantly focused on ServiceNow and SAP to generate significant, big-ticket deals. The ideal candidate will demonstrate a strong customer-centric approach, ensuring that solutions align with client needs over technological complexity, and have a proven track record of successful high-value deal closures in the IT and technology sector. Our growth ambition in the Nordics will focus on
 **the growing needs of AI, data management and cybersecurity while remaining customer centric and solution-focused.** 




  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Strategic Drive and Customer Focus:** 
 Leverage a strong network of contacts to engage senior decision-makers, influencing key stakeholders while focusing on achieving outstanding customer outcomes.
* **Action-Oriented Execution** 
 : Develop and execute a comprehensive business development strategy that aligns with Inetum’s ambitious growth goals in the Nordics market, moving at pace and prioritizing impactful action over perfection.
* **Relationship and Trust Building:** 
 Establish and nurture high-level relationships with existing and potential clients, focusing on long-term partnership opportunities and large-scale projects. Actively manage these relationships to build trust and mutual respect.
* **Solution Strategy:** 
 Collaborate with partners like ServiceNow and SAP to craft simple yet effective solutions that meet the complex needs of our clients, ensuring a deep understanding of their requirements and challenges.
* **Market Awareness and Innovation:** 
 Constantly seek to understand market trends and client needs to drive the development of new offerings, positioning Inetum at the forefront of the technology services industry.
* **Sales Cycle Management:** 
 Manage the entire sales cycle, from prospecting and qualification through to deal closing and post-sale follow-up, ensuring every step is executed with focus and methodical precision.
* **Effective Communication:** 
 Prepare and deliver persuasive presentations and proposals that clearly demonstrate the value of Inetum’s solutions, ensuring they are straightforward and compelling.



  





**Requirements:** 



* Prior proven success, of at least 10 years, in business development or sales within the IT and technology sector, specifically handling large-scale deals.
* Established network of contacts and a proven ability to leverage relationships for business growth would be an advantage, especially across government, financial services, energy renewables and enterprise sector.
* Strong knowledge of ServiceNow and SAP products, with the ability to match their capabilities to client needs.
* Exceptional negotiation and deal-closing skills.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
* Strategic thinker with a proven track record of achieving revenue targets and business growth.
* Ability to travel as needed within the Nordics.
* Fluency in English and at least one other Scandinavian language, preferably Swedish.
* This position is designed for a driven, connected, and innovative business development professional ready to take on significant challenges and drive substantial growth within key markets for Inetum.



  





**What We Offer:** 



* Competitive compensation and benefits package, including an attractive commission scheme.
* Opportunity to work in a fast-growing and innovative company.
* An agile, collaborative and supportive work environment that values diversity as a key enabler to innovation, creativity and success.
* Be part of a leading Global technology solutions services company.
* The chance to make a significant impact on our business in the Nordics regions.



  





 Please submit your application via LinkedIn or email your resume with accompanying cover letter to
 **michelle.ramsay@inetum.com.**

title: Junior Nätverkskonsult
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Har du ett öga för nätverkslösningar och gillar att jobba nära kund? Drivs du av att arbeta med stora, spännande projekt där din insats verkligen gör skillnad? Då vill jag gärna lära känna dig! Jag heter Solveig Jagelid och ansvarar för vår fantastiska konsultgrupp i Stockholm. Vi växer och söker en ny kollega i rollen som
 **Junior Nätverkskonsult** 
 som vill vara med på vår gemensamma resa mot framtidens digitala infrastruktur!
   

  

**Är det här din nästa möjlighet?**
 I rollen som Junior Nätverkskonsult hos oss blir du en viktigt spelare och får arbeta med installation, konfiguration och felsökning av nätverkslösningar. Du kommer att jobba både självständigt och i nära samarbete med andra specialister inom våra tre fokusområden: nätverk, säkerhet och hybrid IT. Här får du chansen att dyka djupt ner i tekniken, utforska nya lösningar och samla inspiration från både Cloud och on-prem. Och vet du vad? Om du på sikt vill certifiera dig inom fler områden så står vi redo att stötta dig hela vägen!
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 Du är en person som gillar att arbeta i ett högt tempo och har en naturlig förmåga att engagera både kunder och kollegor. Du älskar att brainstorma idéer och har en förmåga att förvandla krav till konkreta, genomförbara lösningar. Dessutom är du nyfiken på att växa och utvecklas i din karriär – och vi är här för att hjälpa dig på den resan!
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* Cisco CCNA-certifiering
* Har genomgått en nätverksutbildning, exempelvis på Yrkeshögskola (YH) eller motsvarande
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift


**Varför Telia Cygate?**
 På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.
   

  

 Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.
   

  

 Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan
 **!**
**Låter det intressant? Ansök idag!**
 Ta chansen och bli en del av vårt härliga team! Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig.
   

  

 Placeringsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta mig gärna, Solvieg Jagelid på solveig.jagelid@cygate.se eller via LinkedIn. Sista ansökningsdag är
 **2025-01-31.**
 Bakgrundskontroll är en del i våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of Experts**

title: Engagement- Engineering Manager Tech
description:
Betsson Group is now looking for an
 **Engineering Manager** 
**Tech** 
 within the Engagement Domain
   

  

 The WoW
   

  

 As an Engineering Manager at Betsson Group, your primary responsibilities will be geared towards building and leading high-performing engineering teams, meaning a lot of your focus will be on our most important asset – our people! You will work closely with your product and design counterparts on the planning and scoping of the product development roadmap, where you will be accountable for the engineering teams’ delivery. You will also be expected to take ownership and responsibility for the technical stability and performance of the applications under the tutelage of your teams.
   

  

 A taster of what you will be involved with
   

  

* Build and lead high-performing engineering teams.
* Ensure the engineering teams are properly structured, staffed, and possess the right roles and skills.
* Drive excellence in engineer recruitment, onboarding and career development.
* Foster an engineering culture of ownership, collaboration, and passion for delivering quality products.
* Be an active part of the cross-functional leadership team for the area.
* Collaborate with other engineering leaders across the organisation to share best practices.
* Accountable for the engineering teams’ delivery in terms of both time and quality.
* Work closely with your product counterpart(s) and provide a high level of support for product activities.
* Define team performance metrics to monitor and report on team productivity and individual Team Leads and Engineers performance.
* Drive the continuous optimisation and improvement of team and development processes.
* Take ownership for resolving situations hindering the performance of the teams. Be able to deep dive into solutions, when necessary, track and follow up external dependencies.
* Advocate and advance modern agile software development practices.
* Step into any missing role as and when may be required.


 You are good with
   

  

* Understanding of .NET technology stack and hosting applications both on premises and in cloud, CI/CD and monitoring, messaging within a micro service architecture, automated QA.
* Through collaboration with your architecture and product counterparts, ensure the engineering teams are aware of any strategies, standards and business goals they are expected to follow.
* Making sure priorities are clear and followed.
* Nurturing product knowledge gain, sharing, and documentation standards.
* Nurturing teamwork and collaboration within the domain and with other teams.
* Make sure teams are taking part in building product backlog with clear value for technical initiatives, feature suggestions, improvements, automations etc.
* Driving ownership and awareness of system health, performance and stability.
* Champion technical initiatives for consideration in the product development roadmap.
* Establish a strategy to identify and manage technical debt.
* Ensuring highly effective software development with built-in quality assurance, support and maintenance processes are in place.
* Ensuring SLAs are defined and being actively monitored and followed


 You have experience in
   

  

* Mandatory Hands-on experience in software development, ideally in gaming industry, CRM, payments or similar transactional, highly loaded systems.
* Planning and leading the delivery of product and technical initiatives. Documenting solution designs, agreeing and following up on dependencies.
* Managing engineering teams in terms of employment, professional development, performance evaluation and policies.
* Being responsible and accountable for 2+ engineering teams and directly manage Team Leads.
* Recruitment and hiring of Team Leads and Engineers


 What’s in it for you?
   

  

 We can offer you an environment full of ambition and passion. One day is never like the other as the only constant is change, to the better, to the greater. We strive to be the best in whatever field we choose to play on, and we make sure to have fun along the way!
   

  

* A friendly, open and humble working environment, where you will have the chance to work alongside with colleagues from all over the world
* A chance to evolve your skills together with your colleagues with various programs and initiatives
* Personal development through courses, in-house training and external certification
* Freedom with responsibility


 Challenge Accepted?
   

  

 Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our tech colleagues are talking about.
   

  

 By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

title: ITIL Configuration manager
description:
Är du en ITIL Configuration manager som har erfarenhet av att leda arbetet med konfigurationsdatabaser (CMDB)? Är du initiativtagande, tydlig, uthållig och kvalitetsmedveten? Vill du arbeta i en organisation som är i stor tillväxt och med syfte att bidra till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare? Då kan du vara den vi söker.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 I din roll som ITIL Configuration manager arbetar du för att eftersträva säkra, robusta och ändamålsenliga tjänster. Du ansvarar för att förekommande konfigurationsdatabaser (CMDB) innehåller korrekt och efterfrågat inventariedata över tid. Du leder det operativa arbetet med att tillhandahålla konfigurationsinformation till ärendehanteringen och utbildar förekommande intressenter, exempelvis tjänsteansvariga och IT-specialister. Du arbetsleds av och rapporterar systematiskt till Tjänsteområdesansvarig tillika Process owner. Du stödjer Process owner i arbetet med konfigurationshanteringens budget, design, ständiga förbättringar och nyckeltal.
   

  

 Du kommer ingå i en organisation som är gemensamt intresserad, delaktig och ansvarstagande för förekommande informationssystem, tjänster, processer och rutiner. Vid behov stödjer du även andra delar av och projekt inom Infrastrukturstaben.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
 Du har gymnasiekompetens, IT-teknisk kompetens eller kompetens och utbildning som FMV bedömer likvärdig och värdefull för tjänsten. Du har en god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen som ITIL Configuration manager har du flerårig erfarenhet av konfigurationshantering. Du är i grunden initiativtagande, uthållig och kvalitetsmedveten samt har helhetssyn, men du är också flexibel och ser möjligheter vid ändrade förutsättningar. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Du har kunskap om på marknaden förekommande digitala verktyg och IT-stöd för konfigurationshantering, exempelvis ServiceNow. Det är meriterande om du har kunskap och erfarenhet av förvaltningsstyrning enligt PM3, ITIL 4 och upphandlingar enligt LOU/LUFS.
   

  

 Vi utgår från att du har en vilja och förmåga att lära och utvecklas och du har därför goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling hos oss.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Välkommen till Försvarets materielverk! Vi befinner oss just nu i en spännande tid. Som myndighet i försvarssektorn är vårt uppdrag att leverera det som vårt svenska försvar behöver, viktigare än någonsin. Vi söker därför efter dig, som tillsammans med avdelningens medarbetare och våra samarbetspartners, vill bidra till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare.
   

  

 Infrastrukturstaben ansvarar för myndighetens IT-verksamhet, informationsförvaltning och fastighetsförvaltning.
   

  

 Avdelningen IT drift och infrastruktur söker nu en ITIL Configuration manager.
   

  

**FMV – Försvarets materielverk**
 På FMV är du med och bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare. Vi upphandlar, utvecklar och levererar materiel och tjänster till det svenska försvaret. I vår vision ”Rätt materiel för ett starkare försvar” ryms vårt arbete och våra leveranser till Försvarsmakten av allt från helikoptrar, ubåtar, stridsflygplan och snörade kängor till kompasser, radarstationer, pansarterrängbilar och kuddar. Bredden i vårt uppdrag ger dig möjligheten att jobba med spännande innehåll, människor och projekt. Vi sätter värde på ömsesidigt förtroende och på ett hållbart arbetsliv. Därför erbjuder vi alla våra anställda ett brett utbud av utbildningar, kompetensutveckling och träning.
   

  

**Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens försvar?**
 Sök tjänsten via FMV:s webbplats. Vi vill ha dina ansökningshandlingar på svenska. Våra fackliga företrädare är: Stefan Hållander Saco-S, Peter Andersson SEKO, Lars Mörrby OFR/O och Lena Sköld Gunnarsson OFR/S. Alla nås på telefon 08-782 40 00 (FMV Växel).
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten ber vi dig kontakta tjänsteområdesansvarig IT Verksamhetsstöd, Benita Levander via benita.levander@fmv.se alternativt rekryterande chef Erik Holmberg via erik.holmberg@fmv.se. .
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-02-07.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan.**
 FMV finns för landet, i många delar av landet. Som medarbetare hos oss får du både en trygg och utmanande anställning och ett stort eget ansvar. För att jobba hos oss behöver du vara svensk medborgare och genomgå en säkerhetsprövning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar provanställning och som anställd kommer du att krigsplaceras utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via FMV:s webbplats eller via vår registratur. Vi har redan gjort vårt medieval, därför undanber vi oss samtal från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Chef IT-säkerhet
description:
Vill du vara med och skapa framtidens kollektivtrafik i Stockholm? Varje dag reser närmare 900 000 personer med vår kollektivtrafik, och vi behöver dig för att möta de höga kraven på tillgänglighet, säkerhet och innovation. I takt med allt högre krav från lagstiftning som NIS2 och CER, den snabba digitaliseringen och de växande hoten inom cybersäkerhet, har IT-säkerhet blivit en nyckelfråga för oss. Vår målsättning är att arbeta med moderna lösningar där vi bygger säkerhet från grunden (secure-by-design) och implementera principer som Zero Trust för att säkerställa robust skydd för våra distribuerade system.
   

  

 IT-avdelningen på Trafikförvaltningen söker nu en chef för IT-säkerhet som vill leda arbetet med att stärka och utveckla cybersäkerheten inom Trafikförvaltningens IT- och OT-landskap. Vill du ta ansvar för detta viktiga och samhällskritiska arbete?
   

  

 Som chef för gruppen IT-säkerhet leder du ett team som idag består av åtta medarbetare, varav tre är anställda, med ambitionen att växa och stärka gruppen med fler expertkompetenser. Gruppen arbetar nära Informationssäkerhet och Dataskydd och är en del av sektionen Arkitektur och Säkerhet med cirka 40 medarbetare. Ditt uppdrag blir att utveckla gruppen för att möta både externa hot och de krav som ställs av nya system och regelverk.
   

  

****Om rollen****
 I ansvarsområdet ingår personal- och budgetansvar för gruppen och dess funktioner, samt ansvar för att sätta och följa upp gruppens mål och effekthemtagning. Centrala kontaktytor inkluderar andra säkerhetsfunktioner, såsom säkerhetsskydd, informationssäkerhet och dataskydd, samt säkerhetsfunktioner hos driftspartner och andra leverantörer. I rollen ingår även att stötta IT-avdelningens olika sektioner för utveckling, förvaltning och drift.
   

  

 Några ytterligare exempel på arbetsuppgifter i din roll som chef:
   

  

* Styra det operativa cybersäkerhetsarbetet
* Leda och utveckla SOC Service Management och CSIRT
* Ansvara för andra-linjen support vid hantering av säkerhetsincidenter
* Samordna och styra cybersäkerhetsscanning
* Ansvara för funktionen som hanterar säkerhetstester
* Vidareutveckla och stärka Security Champion-nätverket
* Förvalta säkerhetsskyddsplan och befattningsanalys samt samverka med funktionen för säkerhetsskydd
* Utveckla och förvalta ramverket för säkerhetskrav vid upphandling och inköp


 Du rapporterar till sektionschef och ingår i sektionens ledningsgrupp samt deltar i relevanta styrgrupper och funktioner.
   

  

****För att lyckas i rollen behöver du:****
 Då trafikförvaltningen är en organisation i förändring söker vi dig som har arbetat några år med personalansvar i roll som chef. Vi ser med fördel att du har kunskap och erfarenhet av arbete inom cybersäkerhet och att du arbetat några år som stöd till systemutveckling. Har du dessutom kunskap inom säkerhetsskydd så är det också meriterande. Du har akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet som Trafikförvaltningen bedömer likvärdig. Ditt ledarskap präglas av ett coachande förhållningssätt där du är van att situationsanpassa, motivera och engagera medarbetare. Vi ser gärna att du har kunskap om och förmåga att tillämpa det systematiska arbetsmiljöarbetet.
   

  

 Vårt koncernspråk är svenska vilket ställer krav på att du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat.
   

  

 Som person är du en driven och duktig förändringsledare som är van att planera och strukturera. Din självinsikt och förmåga att bygga relationer gör dig till en stark kommunikatör som kan skapa förståelse och tillhörighet inom organisationen. Du förutser problem och hittar vägar framåt samtidigt som du inte tvekar att utmana status quo. Med ett helhetsperspektiv säkerställer du att mål integreras och resurser samordnas för att uppnå de bästa möjliga resultaten. Du är proaktiv, nytänkande och har en vilja att både utveckla dig själv och organisationen.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Startdatum enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Grundutredning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan komma att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Vissa tjänster ställer krav på svenskt medborgarskap samt omfattas av en säkerhetsprövningsintervju med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

 Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas och eventuella arbetsprov kan bli aktuella för tjänsten.
   

  

****Det här erbjuder vi dig****
 På trafikförvaltningen har du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas för ett helt yrkesliv. Här kan du vara expert och fokusera på ditt sakområde. Samtidigt som du jobbar i ett lag och i en organisation med stor bredd. Det finns stora möjligheter att röra sig mellan olika roller och uppgifter. Du har utrymme att forma din egen karriärväg och stärka både din personliga och professionella utveckling i en spännande och varierad miljö!
   

  

 Vi är en välkomnande och öppen arbetsplats där vi stöttar och hjälper varandra. Vi vet att nyckeln för att vi ska klara vårt uppdrag – är medarbetare som trivs, mår bra och kan utvecklas på jobbet. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid att säkerställa hållbarhet i vårt arbetssätt, bland annat genom att erbjuda flexibilitet i vardagen och hybridarbete när möjlighet finns.
   

  

 Årligen erbjuds hälsoundersökning och friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr. Hälsospåret, vår friskvårdssatsning, innehåller en rad olika hälsofrämjande aktiviteter. SL-kort är en annan uppskattad förmån hos oss. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.
   

  

****Välkommen med din ansökan** 
**!****
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Experis. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsulter Pia Boström, 0703 14 68 66 eller Anki Snis, 0703 77 59 69.
