 Du ansöker med CV via vår hemsida, vi har inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökan via e-post. För att säkra objektiva bedömningar använder vi tester i samband med urval.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 22 januari. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

****Webb och sociala medier****
 För mer information om hur det är att jobba hos oss, besök vår karriärsida . Du hittar oss också på LinkedIn .
   

  

 , #cybersecurity #chef #teamlead #soc #csirt #Nis2 #CER

title: IT-arkitekt Infrastruktur
description:
**Var med och forma morgondagens IT-infrastruktur i rollen som IT-infrastrukturarkitekt hos oss på Martin & Servera i Stockholm!**
 Trivs du i en miljö där du kan kombinera teknisk expertis med att driva förändring och vill jobba i en öppen och inkluderande miljö? Då är rollen som IT-infrastrukturarkitekt rollen för dig! Hos oss på Martin & Servera i Stockholm får du en central roll i att utveckla och framtidssäkra vår IT-infrastruktur. Här får du möjlighet att påverka strategiska beslut, bidra med din kompetens och ditt driv inom flera bolag och vara med på vår resa mot en modernare och mer molnbaserad IT-miljö!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Vi På Martin & Servera Levererar Mat, Dryck Och Tjänster Till Restauranger, Kaféer Och Storkök Över Hela Sverige. Här Är Du Med Och Driver Utvecklingen i En Tid Då Digitalisering Och Ny Teknik Öppnar Upp Nya Dörrar För Oss, Våra Kunder Och Hela Restaurangbranschen. Genom Tekniska Förutsättningar, Nya Arbetssätt Och En Hög Förändringstakt Är Du Med Och Gör Varje Dag Lite Godare. Vi Erbjuder Dig Också
   

  

* Möjlighet att arbeta med komplex IT-infrastruktur i en växande organisation.
* En central och strategisk roll där du påverkar vår digitaliseringsresa.
* En varm och inkluderande kultur samt en arbetsmiljö som värderar balans mellan jobb och privatliv.
* Förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag, subventionerade luncher och möjlighet att löneväxla.
* Ett företag med starka och långsiktiga ägare, där hållbarhet och mångfald och inkludering är ledord.


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 Som IT-infrastrukturarkitekt Har Du En Viktig Roll När Det Gäller Att Utforma Och Säkerställa En Effektiv, Säker Och Hållbar IT-infrastruktur Som Stöder Verksamhetens Behov Inom Tillgänglighet, Säkerhet Och Prestanda. Du Kommer Framför Allt
   

  

* Utveckla och förvalta strategier för IT-infrastruktur och säkerställa att dessa stödjer verksamhetens mål.
* Leda projekt för att förbättra och optimera infrastrukturen, inklusive vår molnförflyttning till Azure
* Samverkar med IT-säkerhetsavdelningen för att fortsätta implementera skyddsmekanismer och motverka cybersäkerhetsrisker.
* Analysera och utvärdera ny teknologi och dess inverkan på vår verksamhet.
* Stödja tvärfunktionella team och vara teknisk mentor för kollegor.


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du ingår i IT-produktionsteamet där du även blir en del av ledningsgruppen samt rapporterar till chef för IT-produktion. Inom IT-produktion finns ca 25 medarbetare där du kommer att samarbeta närmast med enterprise-arkitekt, nätverk- och serverpersonal samt IT-leverantör. Vi är ett team som värdesätter samarbete och delar en vilja att driva förändring och utveckling.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad på vårt nya kontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm, där vi har en modern och inspirerande arbetsmiljö med en fantastisk personalrestaurang. Vi erbjuder också möjligheten att jobba på distans upp till två dagar i veckan.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 För att du ska komma till din rätt i denna roll söker vi dig som är nyfiken och intresserad av så väl verksamheten som IT. Du delar gärna med dig av dina kunskaper och erfarenheter till andra och motiveras av att nå uppsatta mål och driva förändring tillsammans med andra. Du har en stark kommunikativ förmåga som gör att du med enkelhet kan anpassa din kommunikation till mottagarens tekniska nivå. Vidare håller du dig gärna uppdaterad inom AI och andra relevanta områden för din roll.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har jobbat som IT-infrastrukturarkitekt tidigare och har erfarenhet från komplexa IT-miljöer. Du har god erfarenhet av servrar och förstår helheten kopplat till nätverk och kringliggande stödsystem. Du har förståelse för IAM och god insikt i hur man bygger och upprätthåller robust IT.
   

  

 Då du kommer att jobba med koncerngemensamma initiativ inom IT hos oss ser vi gärna att du har erfarenhet av detta sedan tidigare. Vi ser det även som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av SAP, retail och MS Azure. Vidare söker vi dig som har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.
   

  

*Låter detta som en utmaning för dig? Välkommen att forma framtiden tillsammans med oss på Martin & Servera! I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Ada Digital, skicka in din ansökan här.
   

  

 https://www.adadigital.se/lediga-jobb/tech/it-arkitekt-infrastruktur-stockholm/*

title: Player Rewards and Gamification - Senior Product Owner
description:
Are you a Product Owner with a passion for iGaming, innovation, and a love for improving user experiences? We're looking for a talented product owner to join our team and help us bring Betsson Group's vision "to provide the best customer experience in the industry" to life.
   

  

**The Wow**
 At Betsson Group, the Player Rewards and Gamification Area ensures our customers come back for more! It’s all about loyalty. We provide a world-class customer experience beyond the game play featuring exciting features like tournaments, dynamic personalised campaigns, rewards, -gamification features and much more! We also work closely with our CRM and VIP teams to build the next generation back office tools to support their processes.
   

  

 As a member of the Player Rewards and Gamification team, you will manage high-traffic systems that are vital to the experience of Betsson Group users. Your role involves ensuring compliance with Service Level Agreements (SLAs), while also emphasizing non-functional requirements to boost system resilience and reliability. Navigating the landscape of regulatory requirements across various jurisdictions, you will uphold and enhance Betsson Group's global offering. Your contribution will be crucial in fortifying Betsson Group's reputation for excellence in the highly competitive i-Gaming market.
   

  

**A Taster Of What You Will Be Involved With**
* Work closely with Product Managers
* Produce detailed product specifications in the form of user stories with detailed acceptance criteria, complemented by descriptive aids such as wireframes and flowcharts where necessary, to ensure the development teams have all required information to deliver the desired outcome.
* Participate in the product discovery process for assigned initiatives (including hypothesis generation, requirements gathering, design, and scoping) in collaboration with the Product Managers, Product Designers, Data Analysts, and Engineers.
* Assist the Product Manager in ensuring that the product development backlog is properly organised, prioritised, and kept up-to-date.
* Contribute to the product vision, and champion this vision with stakeholders and the engineering teams.
* Ensure that proper analytics, tracking and data collection mechanisms are in place to understand user behaviors and/or product performance.
* Provide the necessary product support to the development teams as may be required to aid their delivery.
* Work with other parts of the organization as and when necessary to ensure the expected outcomes are achieved and are measured.
* Communicate product releases and the status of ongoing product development to the wider organization.
* Hold effective demos and trainings with stakeholders for new product concepts and releases as and when required.
* Ensure that relevant product documentation and wikis are well maintained.
* Perform user acceptance testing of new product releases (or ensure co-ordination of).
* Continuously reviewing the live product to identify areas for improvement and any deviations from the expected experience.
* Assist and support the Product Manager in any matters as may be delegated from time to time.
* Learning the market & customer needs through data and customer feedback.


**What We Are Looking For**
* A relevant academic degree or qualifications in Software Development.
* At least 2 years of experience working as a Product Owner.
* Prior experience in the gaming industry will be considered a big plus.
* Prior experience with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) is a plus.
* Excellent communication skills in English, both verbally and in writing.
* Good skills working with various workshops, documentation, planning tools.
* Experience working with agile and remote development teams.
* Comfortable and confident working with both the technical and commercial sides of an organization.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to break down complex problems into solvable and easily understandable parts.
* Natural curiosity and ability to question assumptions and uncover insights for informed problem discovery.
* Excellent decision-making skills, with the ability to logically measure risk against potential gain.
* A team player capable of building positive working relationships across the company.
* A keen eye for detail and a user centric mindset.


**What's In It For You**
 Much like riding a rollercoaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1700 strong, spread across 7 offices with 900 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognise it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator, and always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
   

  

 At Betsson Group we work with a Hybrid Work From Home (WFH) model, giving you the flexibility of working 3 days in the office (Monday, Wednesday, Friday) and 2 days from home.
   

  

 We offer numerous challenges where your skills will be put to good use! We encourage innovation, collaboration, and celebrate success, where you will be part of a multi-cultural and diverse company, with people from all over the world.
   

  

**CHALLENGE ACCEPTED?**
**Check out the** 
**Betsson Group Blog** 
**to find out what our employees are talking about.**
**If you are interested to learn more, please apply with your CV in English.**
***By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our***
***Privacy Policy***

title: Salesforce Solution Architect
description:
Help build a greener future as our next Salesforce Solution Architect!
 



  





**Job description** 




 Are you passionate about leveraging technology to drive business transformation? Do you excel in configuring and optimizing Salesforce to meet strategic goals? If so, we want to hear from you!
 



  





 We’re on a mission to enhance customer experience and loyalty while ensuring our operations are efficient, scalable, and future-proof and you will be a key stakeholder in enabling the organization with the required toolset and configuration to have the best possibilities to succeed.
 



 We are seeking a skilled Salesforce Solution Architect to join our team and play a pivotal role in optimizing and developing Salesforce to align with our strategic goals and growing business needs.
 



 You will be working closely with stakeholders in the organization, external partners and suppliers to ensure requirements are gathered, well communicated and understood to evaluate implementation and changes to the platform.
 



 Recharge utilizes Sales, Service and Marketing Clouds and you will be developing and implementing our processes across these technologies to optimize our business according to the strategic requirements.
 



  





 You will be a part of the Tech organization that has the overall responsibility of all charging infrastructure software systems, public cloud platforms and IT systems. We are growing as a team and everyone joining the team will contribute to multiple areas and is expected to be able to work independently and in collaboration with the rest of the team.
 



  





 If you thrive in a multi-faceted role that combines technology and business strategy, we’d love to hear from you
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 




  




* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document business requirements.
* Configure and develop Salesforce functionality to align with business and organizational strategy.
* Configure scalable Salesforce solutions tailored to business needs.
* Optimize operations with workflows, automation, and best practices.
* Oversee data migration, cleansing, and system integrations.
* Maintain data integrity and adhere to regulatory standards.
* Act as a trusted advisor for internal teams and external partners.
* Facilitate workshops, training, and demonstrations to ensure system adoption.
* Stay updated on Salesforce releases and industry trends.
* Propose and implement enhancements to improve system effectiveness.
* Deliver projects on time and within budget while ensuring quality.
* Manage change and foster user adoption across departments.



  





**Success factors** 




  




* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience, experience may compensate for a lack of formal education
* 3+ years of experience with technical Salesforce implementations.
* Advanced proficiency in Salesforce configurations (Sales, Service, and Marketing Cloud).
* CRM process design and implementation expertise, including process integration.
* Knowledge of low-code automation and data modeling.
* Proficiency in Salesforce languages (Apex, JavaScript, SOQL) is a plus.
* Familiarity with risk management, security, and best practices for Salesforce
* Ability to communicate efficiently
* Experience from an international working environment.
* Excellent English proficiency and one of the Scandinavian languages is preferred



  





 We believe that the right candidate has a genuine interest in the green shift and is either already driving an EV or is very interested in doing so in the near future.
 



  





**What can we offer?** 




 We offer you a role within a team advancing sustainable transportation and creating a greener future. Your work will have a direct impact on shaping the electric vehicle future. Our core values are Care, Share and Dare where we focus on building a better future in a rapidly growing business, together.
 



  





 · Subsidized EV-charging
 



 · Flexible working hours and hybrid office
 



 · Development opportunities and career opportunities
 



 · An inclusive working environment in a Nordic company
 



 · Very good pension and insurance schemes
 



 · Health Insurance
 



 · Modern and central location in Moss / Oslo / Stockholm
 



  





**Interested?** 




 Do you want to start an exciting and meaningful journey with Recharge and have a lot of fun on the way? Please apply before January 29. Interviews will be conducted coninuously and the position may be filled before end of application period.
 



 Recharge values diversity. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
 



  





**Place of work:** 
 at our HQ in Moss, our office in central Oslo or our office in central Stockholm. Some traveling will be required, primarily within the Nordic region. This role reports to Chief Technology Officer.
 



  





**Application deadline:** 
 Please apply no later than 29-01-2025. Position open until filled. Please apply by uploading your CV and application letter through our recruitment system Nuu.
 



 Questions about the position can be directed to: Ulf Bragnell, Chief Technology Officer: Ulf.Bragnell@rechargeinfra.com or through our recruitment system Nuu.
 



  





*We do background checks on relevant candidate via our partner Semac AS.*

title: SVP Group Business Controller
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **SVP Group Business Controller** 
 in our
 **Stockholm office** 
 – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

 The role
   

  

 You will have the opportunity to work in an interesting and varied role in the team responsible for Viaplay Group’s planning and forecasting processes, management reporting, business performance review process and development and governance of key financial systems. By balancing strategic vision, financial acumen, and operational management, the SVP Group Business Controller plays a pivotal role in shaping the company’s financial health and long-term success.
   

  

 This position combines operational and strategical capabilities with more complex analytical tasks.
   

  

 Strong communication skills are important as there are many different stakeholders within the Group Management as well as within the Finance function
   

  

**Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities**
* Ownership of the finance management framework from a Group Business Control perspective, leading the budgeting process and quarterly reviews, forecasting, long-term financial planning, analysing performance trends, and providing insights to guide executive decision-making.
* Coordination and consolidation of the local markets business performance, leading strategic initiatives and developing robust business cases.
* Speaking partner to business controllers and Legal entity controllers regarding e.g. CFM, forecasting process and reporting process related matters
* Responsible and accountable for all aspects of efficient cash and debt management.
* Collaborate with leadership to develop and implement strategies, evaluate investment opportunities, and drive initiatives to enhance profitability and efficiency.
* Monitor and control expenses, develop cost control measures, oversee profitability analysis, and conduct variance analysis to optimize cost structures and address discrepancies.
* Design and manage KPIs and metrics, oversee financial reporting and presentations for senior management, and ensure compliance with internal controls, policies, and regulations.
* Act as a trusted advisor to the CEO, CFO and other key executives, provide financial insights and risk assessments for strategic initiatives, and foster cross-functional collaboration to align financial objectives with business goals.
* Support investor relations efforts by contributing to earnings reports and financial communications.
* Lead and develop finance teams, promote a culture of continuous improvement and financial accountability, and mentor finance professionals to foster growth and development.
* Optimize financial processes and systems, implement technologies to enhance reporting and analysis, and drive automation and digitization of financial workflows for greater efficiency.


 What we’re looking for
   

  

 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* +10 years progressive professional experience from Finance/Controller positions preferably in the media industry, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
* Experience in a listed company is a must.
* Academic degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or related field
* Proven track record in strategic financial planning, forecasting, and cost management.
* Expertise in financial planning & analysis (FP&A), budgeting, and variance analysis with strong understanding of accounting principles, regulatory compliance and risk management.
* Proficiency in financial management systems and ERP tools (e.g., SAP, Oracle); and advanced analytical and data modelling skills using tools like Excel, Power BI, or Tableau.
* Ability to translate financial data into actionable business insights, evaluate investment opportunities, align financial strategies with business goals, and solve problems with a focus on driving profitability and operational efficiency.
* Strong executive presence with excellent communication and presentation skills to convey financial insights.
* High integrity and ethical standards in managing financial operations, and adaptability with proactive decision-making in dynamic business environments.
* Robust leadership skills with the ability to lead and develop high-performing finance teams, drive change, promote process improvements, foster a culture of financial discipline, and collaborate cross-functionally at the executive level.
* Self-motivated with ability to develop new ways of doing things (improve processes, reporting etc)


 What we offer you
   

  

**We’ve got you covered!** 
 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
   

  

**Your wellbeing matters.** 
 We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
   

  

**A safe space to grow and up-skill.** 
 Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
   

  

**Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do** 
 . So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including series & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.
   

  

 Hit play today
   

  

 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Avdelningschef Mark till Ledningssystemmateriel
description:
*Är du en erfaren och trygg chef som tidigare har arbetat i en komplex verksamhet med flera gränsytor och beroenden? Som myndighet i försvarssektorn är vårt uppdrag, att leverera det som vårt svenska försvar behöver, viktigare än någonsin. Vi befinner oss i en spännande tid med tillväxt där vi till verksamhetsområdet Ledningssystem söker en chef till avdelningen Mark som vill vara med på en historisk resa där vi tillsammans arbetar för ett tryggare Sverige!*
**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Avdelningen Mark inom Ledningssystemmateriel omfattar fyra enheter som har produktion och ett nära samarbete med verksamhetsområde Armémateriel på FMV. På avdelningen finns ett fokus på att med modern teknik digitalisera armén med moderna och säkra kommunikationslösningar för att Försvarsmakten på bästa sätt ska kunna leda sina förband. Avdelningen upphandlar ledningsstödsystem för armén och amfibie, markstridsledningssystem samt taktisk markradio.
   

  

 Som avdelningschef leder du fyra enhetschefer och tillsammans med medarbetarna kommer ni att forma och utveckla avdelningens uppdrag och arbetssätt. En viktig del i ditt arbete är att bidra till att medarbetarna arbetar gemensamt så att resurser används på ett sådant sätt att helheten inom ledningssystemområdet optimeras. Du ingår i verksamhetsområdets ledningsgrupp och förväntas bidrar aktivt i ledningsgruppens arbete samt stödjer och rapporterar till verksamhetsområdeschef för Ledningssystem.
   

  

 Som chef på FMV företräder du myndigheten enligt FMV:s vision, verksamhetsidé och mål. Du ansvarar för att en effektiv och ändamålsenlig verksamhet uppnås samt har övergripande verksamhets-, personal-, arbetsmiljö - och resultatansvar för avdelningen. Genom ditt ledarskap skapar du delaktighet och engagemang i enlighet med FMV:s ledarskapsprinciper. Du ansvarar också för kompetensförsörjningen inom avdelningen och ser till att medarbetarnas kompetens underhålls och utvecklas i linje med FMV:s behov.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm. I tjänsten kan resor ingå, såväl inom som utanför Sverige.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
 Du har relevant akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt som vi bedömer som likvärdig. För tjänsten behöver du ha flerårig chefserfarenhet med verksamhets-, arbetsgivar- och ekonomiansvar samt har arbetat i en verksamhet med flera gränsytor, olika affärsområde samt beroenden inom egen och mellan andra avdelningar. Vidare ser vi att du har erfarenhet av samordning, planering, genomförande och uppföljning av projekt, produktion och ekonomi. Tjänsten ställer krav på goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift. Särskilt meriterande är om du har erfarenhet av förändringsledning och varit chef över chefer, för att på så sätt ha lett genom andra. Vi ser det som en fördel om du har arbetat inom offentlig verksamhet och med offentlig upphandling.
   

  

 Som person har du förmåga att göra korrekta avvägningar och prioriteringar genom att väga samman komplex information och du har gott omdöme. Du är öppen för nya lösningar, ser helheter och tar hänsyn till det större perspektivet och kan se till hela verksamhetens bästa. Du kan lyssna och kommunicerar på ett tydligt men också smidigt, lyhört och anpassat sätt. Vidare tar du initiativ och uppnår resultat och har lätt för att anpassa dig till förändrade omständigheter och ser möjligheterna i förändringar. Du är stabil, uppvisar mod och integritet och kan arbeta självständigt samtidigt som du har god samarbetsförmåga.
   

  

 Din ledarstil kännetecknas av en stark vilja till utveckling, vilket syns när du tydliggör mål och ramar för verksamheten. I handling visar du omtanke om såväl medarbetare som andra samarbetspartners. Du förstår också att en effektiv och leveranssäker organisation bygger på en öppenhet inför olikheter.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och som en del i urvalsarbetet kan vi komma att genomföra test med stöd av extern leverantör.
   

  

**Om oss**
 FMV:s verksamhetsområde Ledningssystem ansvarar för att utveckla, upphandla och vidareutveckla materiel och tjänster till Försvarsmakten inom ledningssystemområdet, dvs IT-system som ska underlätta för den som ska leda och fatta beslut. Exempel kan vara mobila kommunikationssystem, försvarets telenät samt operativa och taktiska informationssystem inom armé, marin, flyg och försvarsmaktsgemensamma förmågor.
   

  

**FMV – Försvarets materielverk**
 På FMV är du med och bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare. Vi upphandlar, utvecklar och levererar materiel och tjänster till det svenska försvaret. I vår vision ”Rätt materiel för ett starkare försvar” ryms vårt arbete och våra leveranser till Försvarsmakten av allt från helikoptrar, ubåtar, stridsflygplan och snörade kängor till kompasser, radarstationer, pansarterrängbilar och kuddar. Bredden i vårt uppdrag ger dig möjligheten att jobba med spännande innehåll, människor och projekt. Vi sätter värde på ömsesidigt förtroende och på ett hållbart arbetsliv. Därför erbjuder vi alla våra anställda ett brett utbud av utbildningar, kompetensutveckling och träning.
   

  

**Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens försvar?**
 Du söker tjänsten via FMV:s webbplats. Vi vill ha dina ansökningshandlingar på svenska och för en mer inkluderande rekryteringsprocess tar vi inte emot några personliga brev. Vi använder i stället urvalsfrågor där vi ber dig att utförligt beskriva varför du är intresserad av denna tjänst och vad du kan bidra med. Våra fackliga företrädare är SACO Kari Lehto, OFR/S Pia Edström, OFR/O Arne Molander och SEKO Peter Andersson. Alla nås på telefon 08-782 4000 (FMV Växel).
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Therese Thunström, 073-062 33 72, therese.thunstrom@jeffersonwells.se.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-02-06.
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan.**
*FMV finns för landet, i många delar av landet. Som medarbetare hos oss får du både en trygg och utmanande anställning och ett stort eget ansvar. För att jobba hos oss behöver du vara svensk medborgare och genomgå en säkerhetsprövning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar provanställning och som anställd kommer du att krigsplaceras utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via FMV:s webbplats eller via vår registratur. Vi har redan gjort vårt medieval, därför undanber vi oss samtal från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.*

title: IT-linjechef – Led teamet mot framtidens lösningar
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vi tror att framsteg och möjligheter skapas bäst tillsammans. Välkommen till en plats där samarbete gör skillnad.*
**Din roll**
 Vill du vara en del av ett företag där ditt ledarskap verkligen gör skillnad?
   

  

 Vår organisation levererar IT-tjänster i form av förvaltning och utveckling av IT-miljöer som används i Saabs olika verksamhetsdelar.
   

  

 Våra miljöer gör det möjligt för verksamheten att utveckla, producera och leverera produkter till slutkund på ett effektivt och hållbart sätt. Vi har idag 3 linjechefer och behöver förstärka med ytterligare en kollega i vår ledningsgrupp.
   

  

 Som IT-linjechef hos oss på Saab får du möjligheten att leda ett engagerat och kunnigt team på cirka 25 medarbetare. Vi söker dig som vill skapa en inkluderande kultur där alla känner sig hörda och har möjlighet att växa.
   

  

 Rollen innebär att du stöttar medarbetarnas utveckling och bidrar till att driva innovation och förändring. Du kommer att samarbeta nära olika intressenter inom företaget för att säkerställa att vi uppnår våra mål på ett hållbart och effektivt sätt.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:**
* Stärka teamets kompetens: Coacha och utveckla medarbetarna så att de når sin fulla potential.
* Resurs- och personalplanering: Säkerställ att teamet har rätt resurser på rätt plats för att möta verksamhetens behov.
* Attrahera och behålla talanger: Ansvara för rekrytering, onboarding och skapa en arbetsmiljö där medarbetare trivs och presterar.
* Arbeta med hållbart ledarskap: Driva arbetsmiljöfrågor, säkerhet och riskhantering för att skapa en trygg och säker arbetsplats.
* Strategisk utveckling: Vara en del av verksamhetens långsiktiga utveckling genom att bidra med idéer och lösningar som stärker vårt erbjudande.


 Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats där din röst blir hörd och där du får möjlighet att bidra både operativt och strategiskt.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som är en inspirerande och inkluderande ledare. Du drivs av att stödja andra i deras utveckling och har ett genuint intresse för att bygga starka och välfungerande team.
   

  

 Du behöver inte ha en traditionell IT-bakgrund – det viktiga är att du har erfarenhet av att leda och motivera andra. Vi ser också att du har en affärsmässig förståelse och förmågan att arbeta proaktivt för att skapa långsiktiga lösningar.
   

  

**Vi tror att du har:**
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av ledarskap, gärna inom IT eller annan teknisk verksamhet.
* Förmåga att bygga tillit och skapa en positiv och inkluderande arbetsmiljö.
* Erfarenhet av att leda förändringsarbete och hantera komplexa utmaningar med kreativitet och engagemang.
* Mycket goda kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Ett intresse för teknik och en vilja att förstå hur våra lösningar bidrar till samhällsnytta.


 Har du erfarenhet av IT-drift, design eller transformation är det ett plus, men inget krav.
   

  

*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*
**Vad du blir en del av**
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 23 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.
   

  

 Om du är intresserad av vilka förmåner som du kan ta del av som anställd på Saab i Sverige, kan du läsa om dem här

title: Erfaren IT-tekniker 1st line support
description:
Till ett uppdrag hos en av våra kunder i Stockholm söker vi dig som arbetat några år i en servicedesk och vill utvecklas vidare.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du självklart en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Du kommer att arbeta som supporttekniker där du kommer att ta emot ärenden via telefon och ett ärendehanteringssystem men du kommer även att supportera användare på plats. Du kommer att arbeta med felsökning av datorer, telefoner, utskrifter och applikationer samt ha hand om leveranser av IT-utrustning. Du kommer bland annat att hantera användare i Active Directory och Microsoft 365 samt ge support via fjärrstyrning.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 Vi ser gärna att du har ett genuint intresse för teknik och att ge support. Du är ansvarstagande och driven med ett professionellt agerande; du tycker om att vara behjälplig och vill alltid ge kunden en bra kundupplevelse.
   

  

 Vidare ser vi även att du på ett pedagogiskt sätt kan ge support och vägleda användare, du ska ha förmågan att kunna ta fram en beskrivning av ”helheten” i ett problem genom att ställa relevanta frågor för att på så sätt underlätta felsökningen för teknikerna som ärendet eskaleras vidare till.
   

  

*Krav*
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som supporttekniker
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med Active Directory
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med Windows
* Erfarenhet av att ha felsökt hård- och mjukvara
* Flytande svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift


**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Country Manager - Sweden
description:
**Your mission**
 As the Country Manager, you're not just a leader – you're the clean energy-powered engine, driving our growth across the region. Your mission? To elevate our brand, expand our sales and market share, and champion the shift towards cleaner, greener energy solutions. You'll be the torchbearer of our values, guiding our team and illuminating the path to a brighter future.
   

  

 We are looking for a self-motivated professional with strong analytical skills and a deep understanding of market dynamics.
   

  

 Area: Sweden and Finland
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Establish and execute a substantial strategy for market share expansion across all of Sungrow’s segments PV, ESS and EV Charging.
* Leveraging your expertise to increase our footprint of clean energy products in the country. Lead, mentor, and inspire our talented and diverse team of clean energy enthusiasts, fostering an inclusive culture of innovation, collaboration, and sustainable success.
* Cultivate and nurture relationships with key industry players, partners, and stakeholders, spreading the brilliance of our clean energy solutions far and wide.
* Identify and seize new business opportunities, spark meaningful connections, and cultivate a dazzling network of clean energy advocates.
* Manage budgets, forecasts, and P&L statements, ensuring our fiscal health stays as robust as our panels.
* Serve as a passionate ambassador for sustainability and renewable energy, spreading the gospel of solar power to customers, regulators, and the wider community.


**Your profile**
* A radiant track record of successful business development, sales and leadership, preferably in the solar or renewable energy sector.
* Proven ability to shine in a competitive market, with a knack for turning challenges into opportunities.
* Exceptional interpersonal skills, with the power to forge lasting relationships and build a dynamic, collaborative team.
* A strategic thinker who can navigate the clean energy landscape with finesse, identifying trends and translating them into action.
* A deep commitment to sustainability and a passion for accelerating the clean energy revolution.
* An innovative mindset with a thirst for continuous learning and growth.


**Why us?**
 A chance to be at the forefront of the renewable energy revolution, driving positive change and leaving a lasting impact.
   

  

 An empowering and dynamic work environment where your ideas can shine as bright as the sun.
   

  

 Competitive compensation and benefits, because we believe in rewarding brilliance. Opportunities for professional development and growth, because even the sun keeps rising.
   

  

 Ready to Shine?
   

  

 If you're ready to steer the solar ship, amplify our presence, and light up the future, we want to hear from you. Join us in illuminating a sustainable tomorrow – one solar-powered smile at a time.
   

  

 Job Description is subject to change and it is expected by the employee to be flexible on performing various tasks that might not be included in above description.
   

  

**About Us**
 We are a green tech company with young creative minds.
   

  

 We are fighting every day to make our mission happen –
 **Clean Power for All** 
 !
   

  

 With 500+GW of clean power presently installed worldwide, we are on the road to success!
   

  

 Welcome at Sungrow
   

  

 Founded in 1997 by University Professor Cao Renxian, Sungrow is a leader in the research and development of solar inverters with the largest dedicated R&D team in the industry and a broad product portfolio offering PV inverter solutions and energy storage systems for utility-scale, commercial & industrial, and residential applications, as well as internationally recognized floating PV plant solutions, NEV driving solutions, EV charging solutions and renewable hydrogen production systems.
   

  

 Want to know more? Check out what working with us is like!

title: Cloud-Arkitekt
description:
**Är du en erfaren specialist med hög kompetens och lång erfarenhet inom Cloud-arkitektur som söker nästa utmaning? Då är du varmt välkommen att hänga med på Avegas framgångsresa och fortsätta att bygga upp vårt Cloud erbjudande!** 




 Avega är ett konsultföretag inom digital transformation och innovation. Hos oss hittar du erfarna specialistkonsulter som tar ledande/rådgivande nyckelroller hos kunderna.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder dig:
 


* En dynamisk arbetsplats med härliga kollegor.
* Ett konsultuppdrag som du är med och väljer, utifrån ditt intresseområde och erfarenhet. Enligt vår matchningsprincip 1:1 siktar vi på en 100% matchning mellan kund och konsult för att försäkra oss om att du får arbeta i spännande uppdrag.
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, inte bara i ditt uppdrag men även genom Avegas kompetensforum Elevate.
* Roliga bolagsaktiveter och fantastiska nätverksmöjligheter.



  





 Rollen syftar till att utifrån våra kunders behov, designa och utveckla framtidssäkra lösningar på teknik i framkant att möta morgondagens utmaningar. För att lyckas, ställs höga krav på såväl personliga egenskaper, teknisk kompetens som samarbetsförmåga.
 



 Är du den vi söker har du en bred teknisk kompetens för att förstå kundens befintliga IT-landskap och IT-system, både vilka möjligheter de erbjuder och vilka begränsningar de har. Du ska ha en god förståelse för arkitekturprinciper samt erfarenhet av analys och design, planering och implementering av Cloud-lösningar. Har du kompetens inom området integration eller IT-säkerhet är det ett extra plus!
 



  





**Övriga kvalifikationer:** 



* Minst sex års erfarenhet av rollen som IT-arkitekt.
* Erfarenhet inom någon av Cloud teknologierna Azure, AWS eller GCP.
* Vana att fånga och dokumentera kundens behov, driva workshops, rekommendera och implementera kundlösningar samt hantera kundförväntningar.
* Utbildningsbakgrund inom IT.
* Goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska.
* Vi ser positivt på om du har relevanta Cloud certifieringar och erfarenhet av CI/CD, Docker och Kubernetes.



  





 Vi tror också att du gillar att se kreativa lösningar och bidra med egna förslag på olika funktioner i våra projekt. Samarbete är förmodligen ett ledord hos dig och att arbeta nära sina kollegor för att nå resultat faller sig naturligt.
 



  





 Låter det spännande? Hör av dig så kan vi prata vidare!

title: Sap Financial Accounting Consultant
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
Presales Consultant / Presales Engineer / Sales Engineer / Technical Sales / Solution Consultant / Solution Engineer / SAP Consultant / ERP Consultant / SAP FI Consultant - SAP S4/HANA (Finance & Accounting)
 



  





**We are looking for a Nordic speaker SAP or ERP consultant who is open for relocating to sunny Barcelona!** 




  





**Barcelona = sunny skies, beach days, and a vibrant lifestyle, all with a much lower cost of living.** 
 You’ll also join their dynamic young professional community. With 250+ colleagues organizing meetups and group outings, you’ll never be short of things to do!
 



  





 Our client is one of the world's largest enterprise software vendor and a partner for SAP ERP solutions with over 100,000 employees, 150+ global offices and $30 billion revenue.
 



  





 They are looking for a Nordics speaking SAP S4 HANA solution consultant to join their digital hub in Barcelona, focused on fast growing mid market clients across different domains:
 



  





 You will act as domain expert and work on solution lifecycle from presales, demonstrating product value, client presentation, analysing requirements, advising on product features/modules, migration, integrations, etc.
 



  





 Experience:
 



 -3 years + working as presales or sales engineer or solution engineer or solution consultant or implementation consultant or finance/accounting consulting
 



 -Experience in any ERP or SAP solutions or Accounting software or Financial software, (such as SAP S4 or SAP ECC or Dynamics Finance/F&O, Infor, Oracle, Sage, Workday, Netsuite, IFS, Xero, etc. is a big plus)
 



 -Knowledge in finance or accounting or procurement
 



**-Must speak one of the Nordic languages** 




**-Willing to relocate to Barcelona** 




  





 Full time permanent role and offer:
 



 -Hybrid & flexible working/3 days per week on site in Barcelona
 



 -75k to 95k Euro OTE (80% base + 20% bonus with flexibility + full benefits)
 



 -Relocation scheme
 



  





 Keyword: SAP FICO / SAP FI/CO / SAP Finance / SAP Accounting / SAP S4 / SAP S4/HANA / SAP S4 HANA / SAP ECC / SAP ERP / SAP Business one

title: Senior Product Owner
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Du skall ha lång erfarenhet som ledare och PO. Snabbt komma in i produkten och driva utvecklingen av den.
   

  

 BI/Data bakgrund är en fördel.
   

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 20-01-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: IT Risk Management Consultant | Risk Consulting | Stockholm Gothenburg and Malmö
description:
Are you passionate about IT risk management and eager to help organizations achieve effective governance and proactive risk management across the technology environment? Do you excel in dynamic, diverse environments and possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills? If you do, then you might be a perfect fit for our Risk Consulting practice. We are currently recruiting IT Risk Management Consultants in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Malmö to join our team at EY and help us deliver world-class consultancy services to our clients, guiding them to enhance their IT risk management strategies and navigate complex IT challenges.
   

  

 EY is a global leader in consulting services. Within our global Risk organization, we focus on delivering world class consultancy services to our clients through our broad set of solutions and services. Within Digital Risk, IT risk is a crucial area for organizations seeking regulatory compliance and effective governance. We help companies strengthen their IT governance, enhance IT risk management programs, and optimize IT internal controls.
   

  

 As part of our ambitious plans to expand our market-leading Risk Consulting practice, we are looking for excellent people to join our team. Being part of a dynamic, growing organization offers an exciting career path full of opportunities. EY’s Swedish Risk Consulting practice is part of a global team of professionals focused on delivering leading-edge services. We are part of a wider advisory organization that collectively comprises a $10.0 billion and growing global advisory practice with 50,000 professionals.
   

  

**Your role as IT Risk Management Consultant**
 You will be part of a team where you will guide national and international companies to enhance their IT risk management strategies. Your role will involve assessing, designing and implementing IT risk processes, frameworks and controls to improve organizational resilience. You will play a key role in identifying new business opportunities and actively contribute to the growth and enhancement of our IT risk consulting practice and service offerings. By staying ahead of industry trends, you will help companies navigate complex IT challenges while contributing to the growth of our consulting services.
   

  

**To qualify for the role you must have**
* Relevant educational background (IT, Risk management, Business/economics, Cybersecurity, Information Security or similar)
* 4-8 years of experience in IT risk management, IT governance, and internal audit of IT systems
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
* Full professional proficiency in English (Swedish is meritorious)


**What We Offer**
* Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


 To learn more about EY and what it’s like to work here, please follow us on EY Careers, Career blog and social media (@eysecareers).
   

  

**Want to take the next step in your career with us?**
 Then you welcome to apply for the position. Submit your application no later than 28th of February 2025, selection and interviews are ongoing.
   

  

 For questions about the position, contact Kristina Lundgren at Kristina.lundgren@se.ey.com. For questions about the recruitment process, contact Simon Aspler at simon.aspler@se.ey.com. Start date is by agreement. Please note that a background check will be conducted as part of the recruitment process.
   

  

*At EY, we offer an inclusive environment and support the differences of our people. With our focus on diversity, we encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds. If you need any support or adjustments during the recruitment process or the employment, please contact our local recruitment team at* 
*recruitmentsweden@se.ey.com* 
*and let us know how we can support you in the best way. Read more* 
*here* 
*.*
**EY | Building a better working world**
 EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
   

  

 Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
   

  

 Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
   

  

**Shape your future with confidence. Join EY today!**

title: Digital Communications Manager
description:
Are you a senior digital communications professional ready to take the lead in shaping the digital communication landscape within a global industrial frontrunner? Do you thrive in strategic thinking and hands-on execution while inspiring a team of experts? And do you excel as a strong networker who easily navigates in a global organization with a variety of stakeholders? Then we have an opportunity for you!
   

  

 Sandvik Group is looking for a Digital Communications Manager to orchestrate and optimize our digital communications strategies. By setting the path forward for our digital channel landscape, you’ll ensure engaging and relevant communications towards all our target audiences, both internally and externally.
   

  

**Why join us in this role?**
 At Sandvik, we pioneer cutting-edge engineering solutions that shape industries where we operate and make a real difference. We welcome you to an inclusive, agile and fun working environment where we enable innovation and healthy collaborations. We offer you:
   

  

* The opportunity to lead and shape Sandvik’s digital communications strategy on a global scale
* A collaborative and innovative environment that values your expertise
* Professional growth in a role that blends strategic vision with operational impact
* A focus on work-life balance with the freedom to lead without managerial responsibilities
* To be part of the highly skilled Sandvik Group Communications Team where you will be exposed to stakeholders across the Sandvik universe, and you will have the opportunity to learn from your closest team and colleagues


**Your mission**
 Our current Digital Communications Manager is moving to new challenges, and we're now recruiting her replacement. As our next Digital Communications Manager, you’re the strategic and operational driving force behind our digital communication platforms. From the overall strategy and web management to social media, SEM, SEO, intranet strategy and other internal engagement tools, your role encompasses a broad spectrum of responsibilities aimed at enhancing our global digital presence. Your role includes leading and coordinating the work of managers or higher professional levels to achieve agreed business and functional results, but in an indirect manner (without line manager responsibility).
   

  

 You ensure that we stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in digital marketing and communication to ensure the organization remains competitive and that our brand foundations are present in all digital touchpoints. You’re also a key player in developing and creating the Sandvik branding campaigns, which have been internally awarded at several occasions.
   

  

 Your key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
   

  

* Strategize and optimize: Lead the development and execution of cutting-edge strategies for SEO, SEM, social media, and web to ensure maximum visibility and engagement
* Develop digital tools: Oversee the evolution of platforms such as our website, intranet, and digital asset management systems, ensuring seamless functionality and user experience
* Project leadership: Manage new initiatives, like the building and launch of our next-generation intranet, while steering cross-functional collaboration and driving towards our digital "north star"
* Analytics and insights: Use data to inform decisions, refine strategies, and report on performance across digital channels
* Inspire and collaborate: Lead a team of experts by providing strategic direction and fostering an environment of innovation and agile teamwork – without formal managerial responsibilities
* Stakeholder engagement: Align digital efforts with internal and external stakeholders to amplify our brand and meet organizational goals
* Agency management: Evaluate, manage, and collaborate with external suppliers to balance in-house and outsourced needs


 The location for this position is Stockholm and we apply a hybrid work set-up, allowing you to combine office and remote work. You report to the Vice President of Corporate Communications Relations and Productions at Sandvik Group.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We’re looking for a senior expert in digital communications, data and analytics, who has experience and curiosity in generative AI, an understanding of IT requirements, and skills in writing and channel management. You are a skilled content creator with the ability of transferring corporate messages and strategies into compelling content. You have vast experience of working with communications at international companies or agencies, and your experience is backed by a relevant university degree. Acting in a global setting calls for excellent skills in English
   

  

 We highly value your soft skills! By combining your strategic thinking, analytical skills, technical expertise and an agile mindset, you can set targets, monitor performance and adjust strategies as needed to achieve results. Being self-motivated, outgoing, and confident, you also know how to prioritize and creatively solve problems. Add to this an eye for details, a passion for collaboration and a great ability to create networks, and you’re a perfect match for this job!
   

  

 We believe that you will tick the following boxes:
   

  

* Senior-level expertise in digital communications, with a proven track record in SEO, SEM, social media, internal digital communications and website strategy
* A visionary thinker with hands-on experience in project management and leading cross-functional teams
* Strong technical acumen in digital platforms and tools, coupled with a creative mindset for user experience design
* Exceptional analytical skills to translate data into actionable strategies
* A collaborative approach to working with internal teams, external partners, and global stakeholders
* Passion for staying ahead of digital trends and translating them into impactful business outcomes


**Our culture**
 At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. We invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact:
   

  

 James Crilley, Executive Talent Acquisition Expert, james.crilley@sandvik.com
   

  

 We have already decided on what advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts.
   

  

**Hiring Manager**
 Edvard Bergström, Vice President of Corporate Communications Relations and Productions at Sandvik Group.
   

  

 Union contacts – Sweden
   

  

 Kristina Sundell, Unionen, +46 (0)70 211 64 00
   

  

 Erik Knebel, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)173 846 10
   

  

 Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)26 26 19 84
   

  

**Application**
 If you’re passionate about digital innovation, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today to be part of a rockstar team that’s shaping the future of digital communications!
   

  

 Please send us your application through our application system as soon as possible and no later than February 6, 2025. Job ID: R0075044. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

 Our recruitment process is open and fair – we welcome all applicants and evaluate every unique application in line with the specified requirements profile, to find the best match for the position. To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.
   

  

*Sandvik is a global, high-tech engineering group providing solutions that enhance productivity, profitability and sustainability for the manufacturing, mining and infrastructure industries. We are at the forefront of digitalization and focus on optimizing our customers’ processes. Our world-leading offering includes equipment, tools, services and digital solutions for machining, mining, rock excavation and rock processing. In 2023 the Group had approximately 41 ,000 employees and revenues of about 127 billion SEK in about 170 countries.*

title: Automation Support Team Lead to CEVA Logistics
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
**About the job** 




 This service is a direct recruitment, which means that the recruitment process takes place through Bravura, and you will be employed directly by CEVA Logistics. The position offers an excellent opportunity to step into a leadership role within the automation field while contributing to a global logistics leader.
 



  





**Tasks and responsibilities** 




 In the role of Automation Support Team Lead, you will play a critical part in ensuring the smooth operation and maintenance of CEVA’s automated systems. Your responsibilities will encompass both hands-on technical work and leadership duties, ensuring high system availability and effective coordination across teams.
 



  





**Key responsibilities include:** 



* Oversee and coordinate the daily functionality of automated systems, such as the Vanderlande Pocket Sorter, Returns Conveyors, and Vanriet Parcel Sorter. This involves monitoring system performance, addressing any disruptions, and ensuring seamless operations.
* Collaborate closely with the Automation Manager and suppliers to plan, implement, and follow up on maintenance schedules. Ensure that all maintenance activities are conducted efficiently and with minimal impact on operations.
* Track and report key performance indicators (KPIs) related to system availability and efficiency. Log errors systematically, identify recurring issues, and propose improvement measures to enhance overall system reliability.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for Automation, Facilities, and IT Support during day shifts. Facilitate clear and effective communication among teams to resolve issues promptly and ensure smooth workflow.
* Create, update, and maintain essential documentation, including work instructions, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and spare parts inventories. This ensures that processes are well-documented, and resources are easily accessible.
* Mentor and train team members to build their technical competence and ensure adherence to CEVA’s 5S methodology and quality standards. Support a culture of continuous learning and improvement within the team.
* Collaborate with IT support and key users to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to automation systems.



  





 This role combines technical expertise with strong communication skills, requiring an individual who thrives in a dynamic and collaborative environment.
 



  





**Education, experience and personal characteristics** 




  





 Education:
 


* Higher education in automation or technology, or equivalent experience.



  





 Experience:
 


* Minimum 1-year work experience in automation within warehousing, e-commerce production, retail, or a similar field.
* At least 3 years’ experience in automation as a service technician or similar role.
* Proficiency in warehouse management systems (e.g., Ultimo).



  





 Personal characteristics:
 



 We are looking for someone with a positive and curious mindset who thrives on leading and inspiring a team. You should have strong communication and organizational skills, allowing you to effectively manage schedules and resources while maintaining a clear overview of operations. A process-oriented and flexible approach, combined with a cooperative attitude and a strong focus on customer satisfaction, will be essential for success in this role.
 



  





**Other information** 




**Start:** 
 Upon agreement
 



**Location:** 
 Brunna, Stockholm
 



**Salary:** 
 Upon agreement
 



  





 Questions about Bravura's recruitment process? You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions here: https://www.bravura.se/karriar/
 



 Or if you have specific questions about the service, please email to info@bravura.se.
 



 We recommend that you submit your application immediately as we make a continuous selection.
 



  





 Welcome with your application!

title: Legal Counsel
description:
Hey there! Are you our next Leadstar? Take the chance of a lifetime and join a market leading, fast-paced team in the sports betting affiliate industry!
 



  





 We offer you:
 


* The opportunity to play an important role in one of the fastest growing tech companies in Sweden
* The opportunity to learn a lot and to develop yourself
* The prospect to grow within the company and take on more responsibilities
* A workplace where Mondays feel like Fridays



  





 What we want in return:
 


* A high level of commitment
* An eagerness to learn and to become the best
* Smartness and creativity
* A positive mindset



  





**Who are we looking for?** 




 We are looking for a Legal Counsel who has:
 


* Post-qualified legal experience is positive, but match in personality and mindset is the most important
* Strong English legal writing and legal research skills
* The ability to work independently and as part of a team
* The ability to work in a fast-paced and pressurised environment and to act decisively
* The ability to work on multiple projects to a high standard simultaneously
* Clear concise written and verbal communication skills with solid business acumen, this is essential
* Experience and exposure to drafting and negotiation of international commercial agreements. Exposure to alternative dispute resolution methods is preferable, but not mandatory
* Prior experience with corporate legal aspects is considered an advantage
* Potentially had previous experience working within the iGaming industry, however, it is not a requirement



  





**Job description** 




 From day one you will single-handedly take on full responsibility in all legal aspects of Leadstar Media. You will work closely with our Management team as they aid you in building a strong platform for the legal department.
 



 Your work tasks will include the following:
 


* Drafting, reviewing, advising and negotiating legal contracts with iGaming operators
* Drafting, reviewing and advising other potential legal contracts
* Drafting, reviewing, advising on application processes of affiliate licences in different legal jurisdictions, as well as licence application management and licence management after acquisition
* Keeping updated on current changes in all relevant areas of law
* Advising on the legal and regulatory risk involved in Leadstar Media business
* Advising internal stakeholders, including Account Management and Human Resources, in contract negotiations, general legal and commercial concerns
* Litigious and non-litigious matters working with external lawyers and government agencies as necessary



  





 At Leadstar Media you always have the possibility to grow within the company and take on more responsibilities. Several of our team members have taken career steps within the company. The ambition to learn and the ability to take on responsibility are the essential skills required of prospective employees. With this particular role, you will be working closely with the management team to build up the legal department.
 



  





  





**About Leadstar Media** 




 Leadstar Media is a fast growing Swedish scale-up company that operates several websites within the sports betting industry. Today the company consists of over 70 employees and full-time consultants as well as several part-time freelancers. We are an international company with around 30 different nationalities represented and a presence in over 30 different geographical markets. Leadstar Media’s ambition is to create exceptional products for our visitors and to become the no. 1 sports betting affiliate in the world. We believe that the best way to achieve this is by having a tight-knit team of creators with a high level of autonomy.
 



 At Leadstar Media you will work together with entrepreneurial individuals who are eager to learn everything about their particular field. We want you to have the same winner mindset as the rest of the team!
 



 In addition to work, we organize other activities outside of work-hours such as small events, company trips and kick-offs.
 



 At Leadstar Media you always have the opportunity to grow within the company and take on more responsibility. Several of our talents have grown to become true stars and leaders. We have learned that the most important skills you need for this job are an ambition to learn, and the ability to take on responsibility.
 



  





 Please apply directly through our career page: https://careers.leadstarmedia.com/jobs/5188027-legal-counsel
 



  





**More information** 




 Start: As soon as possible
 



 Period of employment: six months probationary employment with one month of notice.
 



 We are looking forward to receiving your job application!
 



 Follow Leadstar Media on Linkedin
 



 Follow Leadstar Media on Instagram
 



 Follow Leadstar Media on Facebook

title: Senior Management Consultant
description:
**What We Are Looking For**
* 10 years + Management Consulting experience. You should have substantial experience in the trade of Management Consulting, having spent time at a well-recognised consulting firm.
* Possess excellent business development skills, with a strong network and reputation in the marketplace.
* Currently working as a Project or Programme Manager within the Business Transformation, Digital/IT Management Consulting and Business Development space. Result driven with long experience from driving strategically important projects on behalf of clients.
* Self-motivated, forward leaning consultant with the ability to embrace the Aurentor way of working quickly and achieve lasting results together with our clients.
* Masters Educated


**What We Can Offer**
* A truly unique and dedicated way of consulting, with a focus on re-establishing the good reputation of consulting!
* The opportunity to work at senior to executive level at our clients, with their most complex and business critical projects, together with some of the most experienced and well-respected management consultants in the business.
* A prestigious-less and flat hierarchal structure, to make sure we deliver tangible value to our clients.
* A culture that focus on value delivered but still acknowledge life’s different situations and circumstances, and therefore adopt a humane view to your work/life balance.
* A market leading and unique salary model (and profit share bonus) which is in line with our business spirit and linked to your own performance as well as that of the company.


**What You Will Do**
* We are looking to recruit Senior Management Consultants with an entrepreneurial mind-set.
* You will work in close collaboration with our clients on Strategy Implementation, Business Design and Business Transformation projects.
* You will work in teams together with your colleagues and normally with the partners liaising closely with our client’s senior management team (c-suite) to deliver tangible value on some of their most complex and business critical projects and programs
* You will focus on value and never Aurentor’s or your own utilization.
* You will be expected to develop long term relationships with our clients, and in time create new business opportunities and business deals


**Who is** 
**Aurentor?**
 Aurentor is a niche management consulting company created in 2010. We are a team of experienced management consultants who share two simple aims: to deliver turnarounds, transitions and transformations for our clients, and to change the way people think about consultants. We do this by aligning our objectives perfectly with those of our clients, and by rolling up our sleeves and working side by side with them and their employees so we achieve the desired results together.
   

  

 Our consultants have the experience to understand the challenges our clients face, the skills to assume responsibility and the determination to see transformations through.
   

  

 Aurentor is a small, agile team of visionary consultants, all with proven success in driving turnarounds and business transformation.
   

  

 As part of the Newground Alliance – a multi-sector group of independent consultants based in Stockholm, Sweden – working at Aurentor allows you to meet, work and socialize with team of colleagues who share a people-centric vision for our industry.

title: Business Analyst with data analysis focus to Transaction Monitoring, FCP | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is a leading Nordic financial services group headquartered in Sweden and with presence in 20 countries worldwide. As a leading Scandinavian bank, we offer financial advice and a wide range of financial services with a strong focus on corporate and investment banking.
   

  

 SEB’s Financial Crime Prevention (FCP) function will further accelerate SEBs deployment of financial crime prevention capabilities to continuously meet regulatory expectations and to become a leader in fighting financial crime.
   

  

 The FCP Transaction Monitoring Technology and Investigation Platforms unit is now looking for a driven and proactive Business Analyst with a special focus on data to contribute to the data-driven journey by taking an active part in the needed data transformation. This role can be based in Stockholm, Riga, or Copenhagen.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As a Business Analyst at SEB, you'll be part of an inclusive team of professional and engaged colleagues. You'll have the opportunity to work in a dynamic and international environment in close collaboration with development organizations (Tribes). The purpose of the role is to continuously aid in the development of SEB’s Transaction Monitoring Systems and Platforms. The role consists of, but is not limited to:
   

  

* Conduct data analysis on large amounts of data to identify trends or inconsistencies
* Conduct data mapping and identify critical data elements for our systems when switching data sources
* Investigate potential data quality issues and contribute to its improvement
* Assist in root cause analysis and business impact for potential incidents


 Your knowledge and excellent communication skills are critical in bridging the gap between our business objectives and technological capabilities. By collaborating and networking with other internal teams within FCP and Technology, you'll also have room to explore other business areas and grow your skills further.
   

  

 At SEB, we embrace a hybrid work model, providing employees with eligible roles and tasks to work remotely up to two days a week.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* Academic degree in Finance, Business, Data Engineering, Mathematics, IT, or an equivalent relevant field;
* Good communication skills and fluency in English;
* At least two years of experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, or equivalent working with data;
* Experience with conducting data analysis and data mapping, including strong skills in data transformation using tools such as Excel and SQL;
* A detailed oriented and structured mindset;
* Experience in SQL and Python;
* Familiarity with Payment flows (considered a strong advantage);
* Strong analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and strategically;
* Well-organized and able to navigate ambiguity while managing multiple initiatives effectively in a fast-paced environment;
* Strong track record of collaboration and teamwork to achieve common goals;


**What we offer:**
* International opportunities and working environment
* Long-term stability
* Training and learning opportunities
* Remote working possibilities and flexible work schedule


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 You are welcome to apply by attaching your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to this position. Considering the Christmas holiday, the recruitment process and response time might take a bit longer than usual. You are welcome to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than the 17th of January 2025.
   

  

 Should you have any questions, please contact Olga Wohlfahrt, Talent Acquisition Partner, at olga.wohlfahrt@seb.se , but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe, or where they come from.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Professional Services Consultant - Nordics
description:
**Connect with Quadient**
 At Quadient, we support businesses of all sizes in their digital transformation and growth journey, unlocking operational efficiency with reliable, secure, and sustainable automation processes. Our success in delivering innovation and business growth is inspired by the connections our diverse teams create every day, with our clients and each other. It’s these connections that make Quadient such an exceptional place to grow your career, develop your skills and make a real impact – help our future-focused business lead the way in powering secure and sustainable business connections through digital and physical channels.
   

  

 Are you someone who likes to use your creativity and problem-solving skills to overcome technical challenges and provide best in class solutions to clients needs?
   

  

 Do you enjoy communicating and collaborating with both internal and external teams of technical and non-technical people, designing, presenting and demonstrating the value-add your solutions can bring?
   

  

 We’re looking for a Professional Services Consultant to join our team in Sweden. Read on for more information…
   

  

**Your role in our future**
 You will be an important member of our Professional Services team, dedicated to the success of customers’ virtualization strategies and their implementations. With your colleagues you will ensure that customers successfully implement Quadient’s solutions, and as a Professional Services Consultant, you will influence the success of each implementation, forming a vital link between the customer and Quadient.
   

  

 We’ve learned that if we put our thinking and efforts together, we’ll achieve better results for decisions big and small. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute at a high level because the way we see it, your input broadens our perspective as well as yours.
